constants.name: CHANGED_ALLOWED_DROP

constants.name: CHANGED_COLOR
constants.doc: The object color has changed.

constants.name: CHANGED_INVENTORY
constants.doc: The object inventory has changed.

constants.name: CHANGED_LINK
constants.doc: The object has linked or its links were broken.

constants.name: CHANGED_SCALE
constants.doc: The object scale (size) has changed.

constants.doc: The object base shape has changed, e.g., a box to a cylinder.

constants.name: CHANGED_TEXTURE
constants.doc: The texture offset, scale rotation, or simply the object texture has changed.

constants.name: CHARACTER_ACCOUNT_FOR_SKIPPED_FRAMES
constants.doc: If set to false, character will not attempt to catch up on lost time when pathfinding performance is low, potentially providing more reliable movement (albeit while potentially appearing to be more stuttery). Default is true to match pre-existing behavior.

constants.name: CHARACTER_AVOIDANCE_MODE
constants.doc: Allows you to specify that a character should not try to avoid other characters, should not try to avoid dynamic obstacles (relatively fast moving objects and avatars), or both.

constants.name: CHARACTER_CMD_JUMP
constants.doc: Makes the character jump. Requires an additional parameter, the height to jump, between 0.1m and 2.0m. This must be provided as the first element of the llExecCharacterCmd option list.

constants.name: CHARACTER_CMD_STOP
constants.doc: Stops any current pathfinding operation.

constants.name: CHARACTER_DESIRED_SPEED
constants.doc: Template:LSL Constant/Pathfinding Character

constants.name: CHARACTER_DESIRED_TURN_SPEED
constants.doc: The character's maximum speed while turning about the Z axis. - Note that this is only loosely enforced.

constants.name: CHARACTER_LENGTH
constants.doc: Set collision capsule length - cannot be less than two times the radius.

constants.name: CHARACTER_MAX_ACCEL

constants.name: CLICK_ACTION_TOUCH

constants.name: DATA_BORN
constants.doc: The date the agent was born, returned in ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD.

constants.name: DATA_NAME
constants.doc: The name of the agent.

constants.name: DATA_ONLINE
constants.doc: TRUE for online, FALSE for offline.

constants.name: DATA_RATING
constants.doc:
Returns the agent ratings as a comma separated string of six integers. They are:
			1) Positive rated behaviour
			2) Negative rated behaviour
			3) Positive rated appearance
			4) Negative rated appearance
			5) Positive rated building
			6) Negative rated building

constants.name: DEBUG_CHANNEL
constants.doc: DEBUG_CHANNEL is an integer constant that, when passed to llSay, llWhisper, or llShout as a channel parameter, will print text to the Script Warning/Error Window.

constants.name: DEG_TO_RAD
constants.doc:
0.017453293 - Number of radians per degree.
			You can use this to convert degrees to radians by multiplying the degrees by this number.

constants.name: DENSITY
constants.doc: Used with llSetPhysicsMaterial to enable the density value. Must be between 1.0 and 22587.0 (in Kg/m^3 -- see if you can figure out what 22587 represents)

constants.name: EOF
constants.doc: Indicates the last line of a notecard was read.

constants.name: ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_AGENT_ADD
constants.doc: Add the agent to this estate's Allowed Residents list.

constants.name: ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_AGENT_REMOVE
constants.doc: Remove the agent from this estate's Allowed Residents list.

constants.name: ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_GROUP_ADD
constants.doc: Add the group to this estate's Allowed groups list.

constants.name: ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_GROUP_REMOVE
constants.doc: Remove the group from this estate's Allowed groups list.

constants.name: ESTATE_ACCESS_BANNED_AGENT_ADD
constants.doc: Add the agent to this estate's Banned residents list.

constants.name: ESTATE_ACCESS_BANNED_AGENT_REMOVE
constants.doc: Remove the agent from this estate's Banned residents list.

constants.name: FALSE
constants.doc: An integer constant for boolean comparisons. Has the value '0'.

constants.name: FORCE_DIRECT_PATH
constants.doc: Makes character navigate in a straight line toward position. May be set to TRUE or FALSE.

constants.name: FRICTION
constants.doc: Used with llSetPhysicsMaterial to enable the friction value. Must be between 0.0 and 255.0

constants.name: GRAVITY_MULTIPLIER
constants.doc: Used with llSetPhysicsMaterial to enable the gravity multiplier value. Must be between -1.0 and +28.0

constants.name: HORIZONTAL
constants.doc: Template:LSL Constant/Pathfinding Character

constants.name: HTTP_CUSTOM_HEADER
constants.doc: Add an extra custom HTTP header to the request. The first string is the name of the parameter to change, e.g. "Pragma", and the second string is the value, e.g. "no-cache". Up to 8 custom headers may be configured per request. Note that certain headers, such as the default headers, are blocked for security reasons.

constants.name: HTTP_PRAGMA_NO_CACHE
constants.doc: Allows enabling/disbling of the "Pragma: no-cache" header.\nUsage: [HTTP_PRAGMA_NO_CACHE, integer SendHeader]. When SendHeader is TRUE, the "Pragma: no-cache" header is sent by the script. This matches the default behavior. When SendHeader is FALSE, no "Pragma" header is sent by the script.

constants.name: LAND_LARGE_BRUSH
constants.doc: Use a large brush size.\nNOTE: This value is incorrect, a large brush should be 2.

constants.name: LAND_LEVEL
constants.doc: Action to level the land.

constants.name: LAND_LOWER
constants.doc: Action to lower the land.

constants.name: LAND_MEDIUM_BRUSH
constants.doc: Use a medium brush size.\nNOTE: This value is incorrect, a medium brush should be 1.

constants.name: LAND_RAISE
constants.doc: Action to raise the land.

constants.name: LAND_SMALL_BRUSH
constants.doc: Use a small brush size.\nNOTE: This value is incorrect, a small brush should be 0.

constants.name: LINK_ALL_CHILDREN
constants.doc: This targets every object except the root in the linked set.

constants.name: LINK_ALL_OTHERS
constants.doc: This targets every object in the linked set except the object with the script.

constants.name: LINK_ROOT
constants.doc: This targets the root of the linked set.

constants.name: LINK_SET
constants.doc: This targets every object in the linked set.

constants.name: LINK_THIS
constants.doc: The link number of the prim containing the script.

constants.name: LOOP
constants.doc: Loop the texture animation.

constants.name: OBJECT_ATTACHED_POINT
constants.doc: Gets the attachment point to which the object is attached.\nReturns 0 if the object is not an attachment (or is an avatar, etc).

constants.name: OBJECT_BODY_SHAPE_TYPE
constants.doc: This is a flag used with llGetObjectDetails to get the body type of the avatar, based on shape data.\nIf no data is available, -1.0 is returned.\nThis is normally between 0 and 1.0, with 0.5 and larger considered 'male'

constants.name: OBJECT_CHARACTER_TIME
constants.doc: Units in seconds

constants.name: OBJECT_CLICK_ACTION
constants.doc: This is a flag used with llGetObjectDetails to get the click action.\nThe default is 0

constants.name: OBJECT_CREATOR
constants.doc: Gets the object's creator key. If id is an avatar, a NULL_KEY is returned.

constants.name: OBJECT_DESC
constants.doc: Gets the object's description. If id is an avatar, an empty string is returned.

constants.name: OBJECT_GROUP
constants.doc: Gets the prims's group key. If id is an avatar, a NULL_KEY is returned.

constants.name: OBJECT_HOVER_HEIGHT
constants.doc: This is a flag used with llGetObjectDetails to get hover height of the avatar\nIf no data is available, 0.0 is returned.

constants.name: OBJECT_LAST_OWNER_ID
constants.doc: Gets the object's last owner ID.

constants.name: OBJECT_NAME
constants.doc: Gets the object's name.

constants.name: OBJECT_OMEGA
constants.doc: Gets an object's angular velocity.

constants.name: OBJECT_OWNER
constants.doc: Gets an object's owner's key. If id is group owned, a NULL_KEY is returned.

constants.name: OBJECT_PATHFINDING_TYPE
constants.doc: Returns the pathfinding setting of any object in the region. It returns an integer matching one of the OPT_* constants.

constants.name: OBJECT_PHANTOM
constants.doc: Returns boolean, detailing if phantom is enabled or disabled on the object.\nIf id is an avatar or attachment, 0 is returned.

constants.name: OBJECT_PHYSICS
constants.doc: Returns boolean, detailing if physics is enabled or disabled on the object.\nIf id is an avatar or attachment, 0 is returned.

constants.name: OBJECT_POS
constants.doc: Gets the object's position in region coordinates.

constants.name: OBJECT_PRIM_COUNT
constants.doc: Gets the prim count of the object.  The script and target object  must be owned by the same owner

constants.name: OBJECT_RENDER_WEIGHT
constants.doc: This is a flag used with llGetObjectDetails to get the Avatar_Rendering_Cost of an avatar, based on values reported by nearby viewers.\nIf no data is available, -1 is returned.\nThe maximum render weight stored by the simulator is 500000. When called against an object, 0 is returned.

constants.name: OBJECT_ROOT
constants.doc: Gets the id of the root prim of the object requested.\nIf id is an avatar, return the id of the root prim of the linkset the avatar is sitting on (or the avatar's own id if the avatar is not sitting on an object within the region).

constants.name: OBJECT_ROT
constants.doc: Gets the object's rotation.

constants.name: OBJECT_TEMP_ON_REZ
constants.doc: Returns boolean, detailing if temporary is enabled or disabled on the object.

constants.name: OBJECT_TOTAL_INVENTORY_COUNT
constants.doc: Gets the total inventory count of the object.  The script and target object must be owned by the same owner

constants.name: OBJECT_VELOCITY
constants.doc: Gets the object's velocity.

constants.name: OPT_AVATAR
constants.doc: Returned for avatars.

constants.name: OPT_CHARACTER
constants.doc: Returned for pathfinding characters.

constants.name: OPT_EXCLUSION_VOLUME
constants.doc: Returned for exclusion volumes.

constants.name: OPT_LEGACY_LINKSET
constants.doc: Returned for movable obstacles, movable phantoms, physical, and volumedetect objects.

constants.name: OPT_MATERIAL_VOLUME
constants.doc: Returned for material volumes.

constants.name: OPT_OTHER
constants.doc: Returned for attachments, Linden trees, and grass.

constants.name: OPT_STATIC_OBSTACLE
constants.doc: Returned for static obstacles.

constants.name: OPT_WALKABLE
constants.doc: Returned for walkable objects.

constants.name: PARCEL_DETAILS_AREA
constants.doc: The parcel's area, in square meters. (5 chars.).

constants.name: PARCEL_DETAILS_DESC
constants.doc: The description of the parcel. (127 chars).

constants.name: PARCEL_DETAILS_GROUP
constants.doc: The parcel group's key. (36 chars.).

constants.name: PARCEL_DETAILS_ID
constants.doc: The parcel's key. (36 chars.).

constants.name: PARCEL_DETAILS_NAME
constants.doc: The name of the parcel. (63 chars.).

constants.name: PARCEL_DETAILS_OWNER
constants.doc: The parcel owner's key. (36 chars.).

constants.name: PARCEL_DETAILS_SEE_AVATARS

constants.name: PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_DESC
constants.doc: Use this to get or set the parcel media description.

constants.name: PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_LOOP_SET
constants.doc: Used to get or set the parcel's media looping variable.

constants.name: PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_SIZE
constants.doc: Use this to get or set the parcel media pixel resolution.

constants.name: PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_TYPE
constants.doc: Use this to get or set the parcel media MIME type (e.g. "text/html").

constants.name: PASS_ALWAYS
constants.doc: Always pass the event.

constants.name: PASS_IF_NOT_HANDLED
constants.doc: Pass the event if there is no script handling the event in the prim.

constants.name: PASS_NEVER
constants.doc: Always pass the event.

constants.name: PASSIVE
constants.doc: Static in-world objects.

constants.name: PERMISSION_ATTACH
constants.doc: If this permission is enabled, the object can successfully call llAttachToAvatar to attach to the given avatar.

constants.name: PERMISSION_CHANGE_JOINTS
constants.doc: (not yet implemented)

constants.name: PERMISSION_CHANGE_LINKS
constants.doc: If this permission is enabled, the object can successfully call llCreateLink, llBreakLink, and llBreakAllLinks to change links to other objects.

constants.name: PERMISSION_CHANGE_PERMISSIONS
constants.doc: (not yet implemented)

constants.name: PERMISSION_DEBIT
constants.doc: If this permission is enabled, the object can successfully call llGiveMoney or llTransferLindenDollars to debit the owners account.

constants.name: PERMISSION_OVERRIDE_ANIMATIONS
constants.doc: Permission to override default animations.

constants.name: PERMISSION_RELEASE_OWNERSHIP
constants.doc: (not yet implemented)

constants.name: PERMISSION_REMAP_CONTROLS
constants.doc: (not yet implemented)

constants.name: PERMISSION_SILENT_ESTATE_MANAGEMENT
constants.doc: A script with this permission does not notify the object owner when it modifies estate access rules via llManageEstateAccess.

constants.name: PERMISSION_TAKE_CONTROLS
constants.doc: If this permission enabled, the object can successfully call the llTakeControls libray call.

constants.name: PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION
constants.doc: If this permission is enabled, the object can successfully call llStartAnimation for the avatar that owns this.

constants.name: PI
constants.doc: 3.14159265 - The number of radians in a semi-circle.

constants.name: PI_BY_TWO
constants.doc: 1.57079633 - The number of radians in a quarter circle.

constants.name: PING_PONG
constants.doc: Play animation going forwards, then backwards.

constants.name: PRIM_ALPHA_MODE
constants.doc:
Prim parameter for materials using integer face, integer alpha_mode, integer alpha_cutoff.
Defines how the alpha channel of the diffuse texture should be rendered.
Valid options for alpha_mode are PRIM_ALPHA_MODE_BLEND, _NONE, _MASK, and _EMISSIVE.
alpha_cutoff is used only for PRIM_ALPHA_MODE_MASK.

constants.name: PRIM_ALPHA_MODE_BLEND
constants.doc: Prim parameter setting for PRIM_ALPHA_MODE.\nIndicates that the diffuse texture's alpha channel should be rendered as alpha-blended.

constants.name: PRIM_ALPHA_MODE_EMISSIVE
constants.doc: Prim parameter setting for PRIM_ALPHA_MODE.\nIndicates that the diffuse texture's alpha channel should be rendered as an emissivity mask.

constants.name: PRIM_ALPHA_MODE_MASK
constants.doc: Prim parameter setting for PRIM_ALPHA_MODE.\nIndicates that the diffuse texture's alpha channel should be rendered as fully opaque for alpha values above alpha_cutoff and fully transparent otherwise.

constants.name: PRIM_ALPHA_MODE_NONE
constants.doc: Prim parameter setting for PRIM_ALPHA_MODE.\nIndicates that the diffuse texture's alpha channel should be ignored.

constants.name: PRIM_GLOW
constants.doc: PRIM_GLOW is used to get or set the glow status of the face.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_ALT_IMAGE_ENABLE
constants.doc: Boolean. Gets/Sets the default image state (the image that the user sees before a piece of media is active) for the chosen face. The default image is specified by Second Life's server for that media type.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_AUTO_LOOP
constants.doc: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether auto-looping is enabled.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_AUTO_PLAY
constants.doc: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether the media auto-plays when a Resident can view it.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_AUTO_SCALE
constants.doc: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether auto-scaling is enabled. Auto-scaling forces the media to the full size of the texture.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_AUTO_ZOOM
constants.doc: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether clicking the media triggers auto-zoom and auto-focus on the media.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS
constants.doc: Integer. Gets/Sets the style of controls. Can be either PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS_STANDARD or PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS_MINI.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS_MINI
constants.doc: Mini web navigation controls; does not include an address bar.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS_STANDARD
constants.doc: Standard web navigation controls.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_CURRENT_URL
constants.doc: String. Gets/Sets the current url displayed on the chosen face. Changing this URL causes navigation. 1024 characters Maximum.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_FIRST_CLICK_INTERACT
constants.doc: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether the first click interaction is enabled.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_HEIGHT_PIXELS
constants.doc: Integer. Gets/Sets the height of the media in pixels.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_HOME_URL
constants.doc: String. Gets/Sets the home URL for the chosen face. 1024 characters maximum.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_PERMS_CONTROL
constants.doc: Integer. Gets/Sets the permissions mask that control who can see the media control bar above the object:: PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_ANYONE, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_GROUP, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_NONE, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_OWNER

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_PERMS_INTERACT
constants.doc: Integer. Gets/Sets the permissions mask that control who can interact with the object: PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_ANYONE, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_GROUP, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_NONE, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_OWNER

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_WHITELIST
constants.doc: String. Gets/Sets the white-list as a string of escaped, comma-separated URLs. This string can hold up to 64 URLs or 1024 characters, whichever comes first.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_WHITELIST_ENABLE
constants.doc: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether navigation is restricted to URLs in PRIM_MEDIA_WHITELIST.

constants.name: PRIM_MEDIA_WIDTH_PIXELS
constants.doc: Integer. Gets/Sets the width of the media in pixels.

constants.name: PRIM_NORMAL
constants.doc: Prim parameter for materials using integer face, string texture, vector repeats, vector offsets, float rotation_in_radians

constants.name: PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_CONVEX
constants.doc: Use the convex hull of the prim shape for physics (this is the default for mesh objects).

constants.name: PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_NONE
constants.doc: Ignore this prim in the physics shape. NB: This cannot be applied to the root prim.

constants.name: PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_PRIM
constants.doc: Use the normal prim shape for physics (this is the default for all non-mesh objects).

constants.name: PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_TYPE
constants.doc:
Allows you to set the physics shape type of a prim via lsl. Permitted values are:
			PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_NONE, PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_PRIM, PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_CONVEX

constants.name: PRIM_SCULPT_FLAG_INVERT
constants.doc: Render inside out (inverts the normals).

constants.name: PRIM_SCULPT_FLAG_MIRROR
constants.doc: Render an X axis mirror of the sculpty.

constants.name: PRIM_SPECULAR
constants.doc: Prim parameter for materials using integer face, string texture, vector repeats, vector offsets, float rotation_in_radians, vector color, integer glossy, integer environment

constants.name: PROFILE_NONE
constants.doc: Disables profiling

constants.name: PROFILE_SCRIPT_MEMORY
constants.doc: Enables memory profiling

constants.name: PSYS_PART_BOUNCE_MASK
constants.doc: Particles bounce off of a plane at the objects Z height.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_EMISSIVE_MASK
constants.doc: The particle glows.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_END_ALPHA
constants.doc: A float which determines the ending alpha of the object.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_END_COLOR
constants.doc: A vector <r, g, b> which determines the ending color of the object.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_END_SCALE
constants.doc: A vector <sx, sy, z>, which is the ending size of the particle billboard in meters (z is ignored).

constants.name: PSYS_PART_FLAGS
constants.doc: Each particle that is emitted by the particle system is simulated based on the following flags. To use multiple flags, bitwise or (|) them together.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_FOLLOW_SRC_MASK
constants.doc: The particle position is relative to the source objects position.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_FOLLOW_VELOCITY_MASK
constants.doc: The particle orientation is rotated so the vertical axis faces towards the particle velocity.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_INTERP_COLOR_MASK
constants.doc: Interpolate both the color and alpha from the start value to the end value.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_INTERP_SCALE_MASK
constants.doc: Interpolate the particle scale from the start value to the end value.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_MAX_AGE
constants.doc: Age in seconds of a particle at which it dies.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_START_ALPHA
constants.doc: A float which determines the starting alpha of the object.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_START_COLOR
constants.doc: A vector <r.r, g.g, b.b> which determines the starting color of the object.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_START_SCALE
constants.doc: A vector <sx, sy, z>, which is the starting size of the particle billboard in meters (z is ignored).

constants.name: PSYS_PART_TARGET_POS_MASK
constants.doc: The particle heads towards the location of the target object as defined by PSYS_SRC_TARGET_KEY.

constants.name: PSYS_PART_WIND_MASK
constants.doc: Particles have their velocity damped towards the wind velocity.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_ACCEL
constants.doc: A vector <x, y, z> which is the acceleration to apply on particles.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_BEGIN
constants.doc: Area in radians specifying where particles will NOT be created (for ANGLE patterns)

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_END
constants.doc: Area in radians filled with particles (for ANGLE patterns) (if lower than PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_BEGIN, acts as PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_BEGIN itself, and PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_BEGIN acts as PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_END).

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_PART_COUNT
constants.doc: How many particles to release in a burst.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_RADIUS
constants.doc: What distance from the center of the object to create the particles.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_RATE
constants.doc: How often to release a particle burst (float seconds).

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_SPEED_MAX
constants.doc: Maximum speed that a particle should be moving.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_SPEED_MIN
constants.doc: Minimum speed that a particle should be moving.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_INNERANGLE
constants.doc:
Specifies the inner angle of the arc created by the PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE or PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE_CONE source pattern.
			The area specified will NOT have particles in it.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_MAX_AGE
constants.doc: How long this particle system should last, 0.0 means forever.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_OMEGA
constants.doc: Sets the angular velocity to rotate the axis that SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE and SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE_CONE use.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_OUTERANGLE
constants.doc:
Specifies the outer angle of the arc created by the PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE or PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE_CONE source pattern.
			The area between the outer and inner angle will be filled with particles.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN
constants.doc:
The pattern which is used to generate particles.
			Use one of the following values: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN Values.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE
constants.doc: Shoot particles across a 2 dimensional area defined by the arc created from PSYS_SRC_OUTERANGLE. There will be an open area defined by PSYS_SRC_INNERANGLE within the larger arc.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE_CONE
constants.doc: Shoot particles out in a 3 dimensional cone with an outer arc of PSYS_SRC_OUTERANGLE and an inner open area defined by PSYS_SRC_INNERANGLE.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_DROP
constants.doc: Drop particles at the source position.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_EXPLODE
constants.doc: Shoot particles out in all directions, using the burst parameters.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_TARGET_KEY
constants.doc: The key of a target object to move towards if PSYS_PART_TARGET_POS_MASK is enabled.

constants.name: PSYS_SRC_TEXTURE
constants.doc: An asset name for the texture to use for the particles.

constants.name: PU_EVADE_HIDDEN
constants.doc: Triggered when an llEvade character thinks it has hidden from its pursuer.

constants.name: PU_EVADE_SPOTTED
constants.doc: Triggered when an llEvade character switches from hiding to running

constants.name: PU_FAILURE_INVALID_GOAL
constants.doc: Goal is not on the navigation-mesh and cannot be reached.

constants.name: PU_FAILURE_INVALID_START
constants.doc: Character cannot navigate from the current location - e.g., the character is off the navmesh or too high above it.

constants.name: PU_FAILURE_NO_NAVMESH
constants.doc: This is a fatal error reported to a character when there is no navmesh for the region. This usually indicates a server failure and users should file a bug report and include the time and region in which they received this message.

constants.name: PU_FAILURE_NO_VALID_DESTINATION
constants.doc: There is no good place for the character to go - e.g., it is patrolling and all the patrol points are now unreachable.

constants.name: PU_FAILURE_TARGET_GONE
constants.doc: Target (for llPursue or llEvade) can no longer be tracked - e.g., it left the region or is an avatar that is now more than about 30m outside the region.

constants.name: PU_FAILURE_UNREACHABLE
constants.doc: Goal is no longer reachable for some reason - e.g., an obstacle blocks the path.

constants.name: PU_GOAL_REACHED
constants.doc: Character has reached the goal and will stop or choose a new goal (if wandering).

constants.name: PU_SLOWDOWN_DISTANCE_REACHED
constants.doc: Character is near current goal.

constants.name: PUBLIC_CHANNEL
constants.doc: PUBLIC_CHANNEL is an integer constant that, when passed to llSay, llWhisper, or llShout as a channel parameter, will print text to the publicly heard chat channel.

constants.name: PURSUIT_FUZZ_FACTOR
constants.doc: Selects a random destination near the offset.

constants.name: PURSUIT_INTERCEPT
constants.doc: Define whether the character attempts to predict the target's location.

constants.name: PURSUIT_OFFSET
constants.doc: Go to a position offset from the target.

constants.name: RAD_TO_DEG
constants.doc: 57.2957795 - Number of degrees per radian. You can use this number to convert radians to degrees by multiplying the radians by this number.

constants.name: REQUIRE_LINE_OF_SIGHT
constants.doc: Define whether the character needs a line-of-sight to give chase.

constants.name: RESTITUTION
constants.doc: Used with llSetPhysicsMaterial to enable the density value. Must be between 0.0 and 1.0

constants.name: REVERSE
constants.doc: Play animation in reverse direction.

constants.name: ROTATE
constants.doc: Animate texture rotation.

constants.name: SCALE
constants.doc: Animate the texture scale.

constants.name: SCRIPTED
constants.doc: Scripted in-world objects.

constants.name: SIM_STAT_PCT_CHARS_STEPPED
constants.doc: Returns the % of pathfinding characters skipped each frame, averaged over the last minute.\nThe returned value corresponds to the "Characters Updated" stat in the viewer's Statistics Bar.

constants.name: SMOOTH
constants.doc: Slide in the X direction, instead of playing separate frames.

constants.name: SQRT2
constants.doc: 1.41421356 - The square root of 2.

constants.name: STATUS_BLOCK_GRAB
constants.doc: Controls whether the object can be grabbed.\nA grab is the default action when in third person, and is available as the hand tool in build mode. This is useful for physical objects that you don't want other people to be able to trivially disturb. The default is FALSE

constants.name: STATUS_BLOCK_GRAB_OBJECT
constants.doc: Prevent click-and-drag movement on all prims in the object.

constants.name: STATUS_BOUNDS_ERROR
constants.doc: Argument(s) passed to function had a bounds error.

constants.name: STATUS_DIE_AT_EDGE
constants.doc: Controls whether the object is returned to the owners inventory if it wanders off the edge of the world.\nIt is useful to set this status TRUE for things like bullets or rockets. The default is TRUE

constants.name: STATUS_INTERNAL_ERROR
constants.doc: An internal error occurred.

constants.name: STATUS_MALFORMED_PARAMS
constants.doc: Function was called with malformed parameters.

constants.name: STATUS_NOT_FOUND
constants.doc: Object or other item was not found.

constants.name: STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED
constants.doc: Feature not supported.

constants.name: STATUS_OK
constants.doc: Result of function call was a success.

constants.name: STATUS_PHANTOM
constants.doc: Controls/indicates whether the object collides or not.\nSetting the value to TRUE makes the object non-colliding with all objects. It is a good idea to use this for most objects that move or rotate, but are non-physical. It is also useful for simulating volumetric lighting. The default is FALSE.

constants.name: STATUS_PHYSICS
constants.doc: Controls/indicates whether the object moves physically.\nThis controls the same flag that the UI check-box for Physical controls. The default is FALSE.

constants.name: STATUS_ROTATE_Z
constants.doc:
Controls/indicates whether the object can physically rotate around
			the specific axis or not. This flag has no meaning
			for non-physical objects. Set the value to FALSE
			if you want to disable rotation around that axis. The
			default is TRUE for a physical object.
			A useful example to think about when visualizing
			the effect is a sit-and-spin device. They spin around the
			Z axis (up) but not around the X or Y axis.

constants.name: STATUS_SANDBOX
constants.doc:
Controls/indicates whether the object can cross region boundaries
			and move more than 20 meters from its creation
			point. The default if FALSE.

constants.name: STATUS_TYPE_MISMATCH
constants.doc: Argument(s) passed to function had a type mismatch.

constants.name: STATUS_WHITELIST_FAILED
constants.doc: Whitelist Failed.

constants.name: TRAVERSAL_TYPE
constants.doc: One of TRAVERSAL_TYPE_FAST, TRAVERSAL_TYPE_SLOW, and TRAVERSAL_TYPE_NONE.

constants.name: TRUE
constants.doc: An integer constant for boolean comparisons. Has the value '1'.

constants.name: TWO_PI
constants.doc: 6.28318530 - The radians of a circle.

constants.name: TYPE_FLOAT
constants.doc: The list entry is a float.

constants.name: TYPE_INTEGER
constants.doc: The list entry is an integer.

constants.name: TYPE_INVALID
constants.doc: The list entry is invalid.

constants.name: TYPE_KEY
constants.doc: The list entry is a key.

constants.name: TYPE_ROTATION
constants.doc: The list entry is a rotation.

constants.name: TYPE_STRING
constants.doc: The list entry is a string.

constants.name: TYPE_VECTOR
constants.doc: The list entry is a vector.

constants.name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_DEFLECTION_EFFICIENCY
constants.doc: A slider between minimum (0.0) and maximum (1.0) deflection of angular orientation. That is, its a simple scalar for modulating the strength of angular deflection such that the vehicles preferred axis of motion points toward its real velocity.

constants.name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_DEFLECTION_TIMESCALE
constants.doc: The time-scale for exponential success of linear deflection deflection. Its another way to specify the strength of the vehicles tendency to reorient itself so that its preferred axis of motion agrees with its true velocity.

constants.name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_FRICTION_TIMESCALE
constants.doc:
A vector of timescales for exponential decay of the vehicles angular velocity about its preferred axes of motion (at, left, up).
			Range = [0.07, inf) seconds for each element of the vector.

constants.name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_MOTOR_DECAY_TIMESCALE
constants.doc: The timescale for exponential decay of the angular motors magnitude.

constants.name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_MOTOR_DIRECTION
constants.doc: The direction and magnitude (in preferred frame) of the vehicles angular motor.The vehicle will accelerate (or decelerate if necessary) to match its velocity to its motor.

constants.name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_MOTOR_TIMESCALE
constants.doc: The timescale for exponential approach to full angular motor velocity.

constants.name: VEHICLE_BANKING_EFFICIENCY
constants.doc: A slider between anti (-1.0), none (0.0), and maxmum (1.0) banking strength.

constants.name: VEHICLE_BANKING_MIX
constants.doc: A slider between static (0.0) and dynamic (1.0) banking. "Static" means the banking scales only with the angle of roll, whereas "dynamic" is a term that also scales with the vehicles linear speed.

constants.name: VEHICLE_BANKING_TIMESCALE
constants.doc: The timescale for banking to exponentially approach its maximum effect. This is another way to scale the strength of the banking effect, however it affects the term that is proportional to the difference between what the banking behavior is trying to do, and what the vehicle is actually doing.

constants.name: VEHICLE_BUOYANCY
constants.doc: A slider between minimum (0.0) and maximum anti-gravity (1.0).

constants.name: VEHICLE_FLAG_HOVER_GLOBAL_HEIGHT
constants.doc: Hover at global height.

constants.name: VEHICLE_FLAG_HOVER_TERRAIN_ONLY
constants.doc: Ignore water height when hovering.

constants.name: VEHICLE_FLAG_HOVER_UP_ONLY
constants.doc: Hover does not push down. Use this flag for hovering vehicles that should be able to jump above their hover height.

constants.name: VEHICLE_FLAG_HOVER_WATER_ONLY
constants.doc: Ignore terrain height when hovering.

constants.name: VEHICLE_FLAG_LIMIT_MOTOR_UP
constants.doc: Prevents ground vehicles from motoring into the sky.

constants.name: VEHICLE_FLAG_LIMIT_ROLL_ONLY
constants.doc: For vehicles with vertical attractor that want to be able to climb/dive, for instance, aeroplanes that want to use the banking feature.

constants.name: VEHICLE_FLAG_NO_DEFLECTION_UP
constants.doc: This flag prevents linear deflection parallel to world z-axis. This is useful for preventing ground vehicles with large linear deflection, like bumper cars, from climbing their linear deflection into the sky.

constants.name: VEHICLE_FLAG_NO_FLY_UP
constants.doc: Old, changed to VEHICLE_FLAG_NO_DEFLECTION_UP

constants.name: VEHICLE_HOVER_EFFICIENCY
constants.doc: A slider between minimum (0.0 = bouncy) and maximum (1.0 = fast as possible) damped motion of the hover behavior.

constants.name: VEHICLE_HOVER_HEIGHT
constants.doc: The height (above the terrain or water, or global) at which the vehicle will try to hover.

constants.name: VEHICLE_HOVER_TIMESCALE
constants.doc: Period of time (in seconds) for the vehicle to achieve its hover height.

constants.name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_DEFLECTION_EFFICIENCY
constants.doc: A slider between minimum (0.0) and maximum (1.0) deflection of linear velocity. That is, its a simple scalar for modulating the strength of linear deflection.

constants.name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_DEFLECTION_TIMESCALE
constants.doc: The timescale for exponential success of linear deflection deflection. It is another way to specify how much time it takes for the vehicles linear velocity to be redirected to its preferred axis of motion.

constants.name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_FRICTION_TIMESCALE
constants.doc:
A vector of timescales for exponential decay of the vehicles linear velocity along its preferred axes of motion (at, left, up).
			Range = [0.07, inf) seconds for each element of the vector.

constants.name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_MOTOR_DECAY_TIMESCALE
constants.doc: The timescale for exponential decay of the linear motors magnitude.

constants.name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_MOTOR_DIRECTION
constants.doc:
The direction and magnitude (in preferred frame) of the vehicles linear motor. The vehicle will accelerate (or decelerate if necessary) to match its velocity to its motor.
			Range of magnitude = [0, 30] meters/second.

constants.name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_MOTOR_TIMESCALE
constants.doc: The timescale for exponential approach to full linear motor velocity.

constants.name: VEHICLE_REFERENCE_FRAME
constants.doc: A rotation of the vehicles preferred axes of motion and orientation (at, left, up) with respect to the vehicles local frame (x, y, z).

constants.name: VEHICLE_TYPE_AIRPLANE
constants.doc: Uses linear deflection for lift, no hover, and banking to turn.\nSee http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_AIRPLANE

constants.name: VEHICLE_TYPE_BALLOON
constants.doc: Hover, and friction, but no deflection.\nSee http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_BALLOON

constants.name: VEHICLE_TYPE_BOAT
constants.doc: Hovers over water with lots of friction and some anglar deflection.\nSee http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_BOAT

constants.name: VEHICLE_TYPE_CAR
constants.doc: Another vehicle that bounces along the ground but needs the motors to be driven from external controls or timer events.\nSee http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_CAR

constants.name: VEHICLE_TYPE_SLED
constants.doc: Simple vehicle that bumps along the ground, and likes to move along its local x-axis.\nSee http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_SLED

constants.name: VEHICLE_VERTICAL_ATTRACTION_EFFICIENCY
constants.doc: A slider between minimum (0.0 = wobbly) and maximum (1.0 = firm as possible) stability of the vehicle to keep itself upright.

constants.name: VEHICLE_VERTICAL_ATTRACTION_TIMESCALE
constants.doc: The period of wobble, or timescale for exponential approach, of the vehicle to rotate such that its preferred "up" axis is oriented along the worlds "up" axis.

constants.name: VERTICAL
constants.doc: Template:LSL Constant/Pathfinding Character

constants.name: XP_ERROR_EXPERIENCE_DISABLED
constants.doc: The experience owner has temporarily disabled the experience.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_EXPERIENCE_SUSPENDED
constants.doc: The experience has been suspended by Linden Customer Support.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_EXPERIENCES_DISABLED
constants.doc: The region currently has experiences disabled.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_INVALID_EXPERIENCE
constants.doc: The script is associated with an experience that no longer exists.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETERS
constants.doc: One of the string arguments was too big to fit in the key-value store.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND
constants.doc: The requested key does not exist.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_MATURITY_EXCEEDED
constants.doc: The content rating of the experience exceeds that of the region.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_NO_EXPERIENCE
constants.doc: This script is not associated with an experience.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_NONE
constants.doc: No error was detected.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_NOT_FOUND
constants.doc: The sim was unable to verify the validity of the experience. Retrying after a short wait is advised.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_NOT_PERMITTED
constants.doc: This experience is not allowed to run by the requested agent.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_NOT_PERMITTED_LAND
constants.doc: This experience is not allowed to run on the current region.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_QUOTA_EXCEEDED
constants.doc: An attempted write data to the key-value store failed due to the data quota being met.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_RETRY_UPDATE
constants.doc: A checked update failed due to an out of date request.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_STORAGE_EXCEPTION
constants.doc: Unable to communicate with the key-value store.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_STORE_DISABLED
constants.doc: The key-value store is currently disabled on this region.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_THROTTLED
constants.doc: The call failed due to too many recent calls.

constants.name: XP_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ERROR
constants.doc: Other unknown error.

events.name: at_rot_target
events.doc: This event is triggered when a script comes within a defined angle of a target rotation. The range and rotation, are set by a call to llRotTarget.

events.name: at_target
events.doc: This event is triggered when the scripted object comes within a defined range of the target position, defined by the llTarget function call.

events.name: attach
events.doc: This event is triggered whenever an object is attached or detached from an avatar. If it is attached, the key of the avatar it is attached to is passed in, otherwise NULL_KEY is.

events.name: changed
events.doc: Triggered when various events change the object. The change argument will be a bit-field of CHANGED_* constants.

events.name: collision
events.doc:
This event is raised while another object, or avatar, is colliding with the object the script is attached to.
			The number of detected objects is passed to the script. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* functions.

events.name: collision_end
events.doc:
This event is raised when another object, or avatar, stops colliding with the object the script is attached to.
			The number of detected objects is passed to the script. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* library functions.

events.name: collision_start
events.doc:
This event is raised when another object, or avatar, starts colliding with the object the script is attached to.
			The number of detected objects is passed to the script. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* library functions.

events.name: control
events.doc:
Once a script has the ability to grab control inputs from the avatar, this event will be used to pass the commands into the script.
			The levels and edges are bit-fields of control constants.

events.name: dataserver
events.doc:
This event is triggered when the requested data is returned to the script.
			Data may be requested by the llRequestAgentData, llRequestInventoryData, and llGetNotecardLine function calls, for example.

events.name: email
events.doc:
This event is triggered when an email sent to this script arrives.
			The number remaining tells how many more emails are known to be still pending.

params.name: agent_id
params.doc: ID of the agent approving permission for the Experience.

events.name: experience_permissions_denied

params.name: agent
params.doc: ID of the agent denying permission for the Experience.

params.name: reason
params.doc: One of the XP_ERROR_... constants describing the reason why the Experience permissions were denied for the agent.

events.doc: Describes why the Experience permissions were denied for the agent.

events.name: http_request
events.doc: Triggered when task receives an HTTP request.

events.name: http_response
events.doc: This event handler is invoked when an HTTP response is received for a pending llHTTPRequest request or if a pending request fails or times out.

events.name: land_collision
events.doc: This event is raised when the object the script is attached to is colliding with the ground.

events.name: land_collision_end
events.doc: This event is raised when the object the script is attached to stops colliding with the ground.

events.name: land_collision_start
events.doc: This event is raised when the object the script is attached to begins to collide with the ground.

events.name: link_message
events.doc: Triggered when object receives a link message via llMessageLinked function call.

events.name: listen
events.doc:
This event is raised whenever a chat message matching the constraints set in the llListen command is received. The name and ID of the speaker, as well as the message, are passed in as parameters.
			Channel 0 is the public chat channel that all avatars see as chat text. Channels 1 through 2,147,483,648 are private channels that are not sent to avatars but other scripts can listen on those channels.

events.name: money
events.doc: This event is triggered when a resident has given an amount of Linden dollars to the object.

events.name: moving_end
events.doc: Triggered whenever an object with this script stops moving.

events.name: moving_start
events.doc: Triggered whenever an object with this script starts moving.

events.name: no_sensor
events.doc: This event is raised when sensors are active, via the llSensor function call, but are not sensing anything.

events.name: not_at_rot_target
events.doc: When a target is set via the llRotTarget function call, but the script is outside the specified angle this event is raised.

events.name: not_at_target
events.doc: When a target is set via the llTarget library call, but the script is outside the specified range this event is raised.

events.name: object_rez
events.doc: Triggered when an object rezzes another object from its inventory via the llRezObject, or similar, functions. The id is the globally unique key for the object rezzed.

events.name: on_rez
events.doc: Triggered whenever an object is rezzed from inventory or by another object. The start parameter is passed in from the llRezObject call, or zero if from inventory.

events.name: path_update
events.doc: This event is called to inform the script of changes within the object's path-finding status.

events.name: remote_data
events.doc: Triggered by various XML-RPC calls with event_type specifying the type of data.

events.name: run_time_permissions
events.doc:
Scripts need permission from either the owner or the avatar they wish to act on before they may perform certain functions, such as debiting money from their owners account, triggering an animation on an avatar, or capturing control inputs. The llRequestPermissions library function is used to request these permissions and the various permissions integer constants can be supplied.
			The integer returned to this event handler contains the current set of permissions flags, so if permissions equal 0 then no permissions are set.

events.name: sensor
events.doc:
This event is raised whenever objects matching the constraints of the llSensor command are detected.
			The number of detected objects is passed to the script in the parameter. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* functions.

events.name: state_entry
events.doc: The state_entry event occurs whenever a new state is entered, including at program start, and is always the first event handled.

events.name: state_exit
events.doc: The state_exit event occurs whenever the state command is used to transition to another state. It is handled before the new states state_entry event.

events.name: timer
events.doc: This event is raised at regular intervals set by the llSetTimerEvent library function.

events.name: touch
events.doc:
This event is raised while a user is touching the object the script is attached to.
			The number of touching objects is passed to the script in the parameter.
			Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* library functions.

events.name: touch_end
events.doc:
This event is raised when a user stops touching the object the script is attached to. The number of touches is passed to the script in the parameter.
			Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* library functions.

events.name: touch_start
events.doc:
This event is raised when a user first touches the object the script is attached to. The number of touches is passed to the script in the parameter.
			Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected() library functions.

events.name: transaction_result
events.doc: Triggered by llTransferMoney() function.

functions.name: llAbs

params.name: val
params.doc: An integer value.

functions.doc: Returns the absolute (positive) version of Value.

functions.name: llAcos

params.name: val
params.doc: A floating-point value.

functions.doc: Returns the arc-cosine of Value, in radians.

functions.name: llAddToLandBanList

params.name: avatar
params.doc: Agent UUID to add to ban-list.

params.name: hours
params.doc: Period, in hours, to ban the avatar for.

functions.doc:
Add avatar ID to the parcel ban list for the specified number of Hours.
A value of 0 for Hours will add the agent indefinitely.
The smallest value that Hours will accept is 0.01; anything smaller will be seen as 0.
When values that small are used, it seems the function bans in approximately 30 second increments (Probably 36 second increments, as 0.01 of an hour is 36 seconds).
Residents teleporting to a parcel where they are banned will be redirected to a neighbouring parcel.

functions.name: llAddToLandPassList

params.name: avatar
params.doc: Agent UUID to add to pass-list.

params.name: hours
params.doc: Period, in hours, to allow the avatar for.

functions.doc: Add avatar ID to the land pass list, for a duration of Hours.

functions.name: llAdjustSoundVolume

params.name: volume
params.doc: The volume to set.

functions.doc: Adjusts the volume (0.0 - 1.0) of the currently playing attached sound.\nThis function has no effect on sounds started with llTriggerSound.

functions.name: llAgentInExperience
functions.doc: Returns TRUE if the agent is in the Experience and the Experience can run in the current location.

functions.name: llAllowInventoryDrop

params.name: add
params.doc: Boolean, If TRUE allows anyone to drop inventory on prim, FALSE revokes.

functions.doc: If Flag == TRUE, users without object modify permissions can still drop inventory items into the object.

functions.name: llAngleBetween

params.name: a
params.doc: First rotation.

params.name: b
params.doc: Second rotation.

functions.doc: Returns the angle, in radians, between rotations Rot1 and Rot2.

functions.name: llApplyImpulse

params.name: momentum
params.doc: Amount of impulse force to apply.

params.name: local
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE, force is treated as a local directional vector instead of region directional vector.

functions.doc: Applies impulse to the object.\nIf Local == TRUE, apply the Force in local coordinates; otherwise, apply the Force in global coordinates.\nThis function only works on physical objects.

functions.name: llApplyRotationalImpulse

params.name: force
params.doc: Amount of impulse force to apply.

params.name: local
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE, uses local axis, if FALSE, uses region axis.

functions.doc: Applies rotational impulse to the object.\nIf Local == TRUE, apply the Force in local coordinates; otherwise, apply the Force in global coordinates.\nThis function only works on physical objects.

functions.name: llAsin

params.name: val
params.doc: A floating-point value.

functions.doc: Returns the arc-sine, in radians, of Value.

functions.name: llAtan2

params.name: y
params.doc: A floating-point value.

params.name: x
params.doc: A floating-point value.

functions.doc: Returns the arc-tangent2 of y, x.

functions.name: llAttachToAvatar
functions.doc: Attach to avatar at point AttachmentPoint.\nRequires the PERMISSION_ATTACH runtime permission.

functions.name: llAttachToAvatarTemp

params.name: attach_point
params.doc: Valid attachment point or ATTACH_* constant.

functions.doc: Follows the same convention as llAttachToAvatar, with the exception that the object will not create new inventory for the user, and will disappear on detach or disconnect.

functions.name: llAvatarOnLinkSitTarget

params.name: link
params.doc: Link number (0: unlinked, 1: root prim, >1: child prims) or a LINK_* flag.

functions.doc: If an avatar is sitting on the link's sit target, return the avatar's key, NULL_KEY otherwise.\nReturns a key that is the UUID of the user seated on the specified link's prim.

functions.name: llAvatarOnSitTarget
functions.doc: If an avatar is seated on the sit target, returns the avatar's key, otherwise NULL_KEY.\nThis only will detect avatars sitting on sit targets defined with llSitTarget.

functions.name: llAxes2Rot

params.name: fwd
params.doc: Forward/Back part of rotation.

params.name: left
params.doc: Left/Right part of rotation.

params.name: up
params.doc: Up/Down part of rotation.

functions.doc: Returns the rotation represented by coordinate axes Forward, Left, and Up.

functions.name: llAxisAngle2Rot

params.name: axis
params.doc: Axis.

params.name: angle
params.doc: Angle in radians.

functions.doc: Returns the rotation that is a generated Angle about Axis.

functions.name: llBase64ToInteger
functions.doc: Returns an integer that is the Text, Base64 decoded as a big endian integer.\nReturns zero if Text is longer then 8 characters. If Text contains fewer then 6 characters, the return value is unpredictable.

functions.name: llBase64ToString
functions.doc: Converts a Base64 string to a conventional string.\nIf the conversion creates any unprintable characters, they are converted to question marks.

functions.name: llBreakAllLinks
functions.doc: De-links all prims in the link set (requires permission PERMISSION_CHANGE_LINKS be set).

functions.name: llBreakLink
functions.doc: De-links the prim with the given link number (requires permission PERMISSION_CHANGE_LINKS be set).

functions.name: llCastRay
functions.doc: Casts a ray into the physics world from 'start' to 'end' and returns data according to details in Options.\nReports collision data for intersections with objects.\nReturn value: [UUID_1, {link_number_1}, hit_position_1, {hit_normal_1}, UUID_2, {link_number_2}, hit_position_2, {hit_normal_2}, ... , status_code] where {} indicates optional data.

functions.name: llCeil
functions.doc: Returns smallest integer value >= Value.

functions.name: llClearCameraParams
functions.doc: Resets all camera parameters to default values and turns off scripted camera control.

functions.name: llClearLinkMedia
functions.doc: Clears (deletes) the media and all parameters from the given Face on the linked prim.\nReturns an integer that is a STATUS_* flag, which details the success/failure of the operation.

functions.name: llClearPrimMedia

params.name: face
params.doc: Number of side to clear.

functions.doc: Clears (deletes) the media and all parameters from the given Face.\nReturns an integer that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation.

functions.name: llCloseRemoteDataChannel
functions.doc: Closes the specified XML-RPC channel.

functions.name: llCloud
functions.doc: Returns the cloud density at the object's position + Offset.

functions.name: llCollisionFilter

params.name: accept
params.doc: If TRUE, only accept collisions with ObjectName name AND ObjectID (either is optional), otherwise with objects not ObjectName AND ObjectID.

functions.doc: Specify an empty string or NULL_KEY for Accept, to not filter on the corresponding parameter.

functions.name: llCollisionSound
functions.doc: Suppress default collision sounds, replace default impact sounds with ImpactSound.\nThe ImpactSound must be in the object inventory.\nSupply an empty string to suppress collision sounds.

functions.name: llCollisionSprite
functions.doc: Suppress default collision sprites, replace default impact sprite with ImpactSprite; found in the object inventory (empty string to just suppress).

functions.name: llCos
functions.doc: Returns the cosine of Theta (Theta in radians).

functions.name: llCreateCharacter
functions.doc: Convert link-set to AI/Physics character.\nCreates a path-finding entity, known as a "character", from the object containing the script. Required to activate use of path-finding functions.\nOptions is a list of key/value pairs.

functions.name: llCreateKeyValue
functions.doc: Starts an asychronous transaction to create a key-value pair. Will fail with XP_ERROR_STORAGE_EXCEPTION if the key already exists. The dataserver callback will be executed with the key returned from this call and a string describing the result. The result is a two element commma-delimited list. The first item is an integer specifying if the transaction succeeded (1) or not (0). In the failure case, the second item will be an integer corresponding to one of the XP_ERROR_... constants. In the success case the second item will be the value passed to the function.

functions.name: llCreateLink

params.name: target
params.doc: Object UUID that is in the same region.

params.name: parent
params.doc: If FALSE, then TargetPrim becomes the root. If TRUE, then the script's object becomes the root.

functions.doc: Attempt to link the object the script is in, to target (requires permission PERMISSION_CHANGE_LINKS be set).\nRequires permission PERMISSION_CHANGE_LINKS be set.

functions.name: llCSV2List
functions.doc: Create a list from a string of comma separated values specified in Text.

functions.name: llDamage
functions.doc: Damage types are provided as a convenience and a suggestion. Scripters are free to add custom ones for their own combat systems or repurpose the damage type fields.

functions.name: llDataSizeKeyValue
functions.doc: Starts an asychronous transaction the request the used and total amount of data allocated for the Experience. The dataserver callback will be executed with the key returned from this call and a string describing the result. The result is commma-delimited list. The first item is an integer specifying if the transaction succeeded (1) or not (0). In the failure case, the second item will be an integer corresponding to one of the XP_ERROR_... constants. In the success case the second item will be the the amount in use and the third item will be the total available.

functions.name: llDeleteCharacter
functions.doc: Convert link-set from AI/Physics character to Physics object.\nConvert the current link-set back to a standard object, removing all path-finding properties.

functions.name: llDeleteKeyValue
functions.doc: Starts an asychronous transaction to delete a key-value pair. The dataserver callback will be executed with the key returned from this call and a string describing the result. The result is a two element commma-delimited list. The first item is an integer specifying if the transaction succeeded (1) or not (0). In the failure case, the second item will be an integer corresponding to one of the XP_ERROR_... constants. In the success case the second item will be the value associated with the key.

functions.name: llDeleteSubList
functions.doc:
Removes the slice from start to end and returns the remainder of the list.
Remove a slice from the list and return the remainder, start and end are inclusive.
Using negative numbers for start and/or end causes the index to count backwards from the length of the list, so 0, -1 would delete the entire list.
If Start is larger than End the list deleted is the exclusion of the entries; so 6, 4 would delete the entire list except for the 5th. list entry.

functions.name: llDeleteSubString
functions.doc:
Removes the indicated sub-string and returns the result.
Start and End are inclusive.
Using negative numbers for Start and/or End causes the index to count backwards from the length of the string, so 0, -1 would delete the entire string.
If Start is larger than End, the sub-string is the exclusion of the entries; so 6, 4 would delete the entire string except for the 5th. character.

functions.name: llDetachFromAvatar
functions.doc: Remove the object containing the script from the avatar.

functions.name: llDetectedDamage
functions.doc: Damage types are provided as a convenience and a suggestion. Scripters are free to add custom ones for their own combat systems or repurpose the damage type fields.

functions.name: llDetectedGrab
functions.doc: Returns the grab offset of a user touching the object.\nReturns <0.0, 0.0, 0.0> if Number is not a valid object.

functions.name: llDetectedGroup
functions.doc: Returns TRUE if detected object or agent Number has the same user group active as this object.\nIt will return FALSE if the object or agent is in the group, but the group is not active.

functions.name: llDetectedKey
functions.doc: Returns the key of detected object or avatar number.\nReturns NULL_KEY if Number is not a valid index.

functions.name: llDetectedLinkNumber
functions.doc: Returns the link position of the triggered event for touches and collisions only.\n0 for a non-linked object, 1 for the root of a linked object, 2 for the first child, etc.

functions.name: llDetectedName
functions.doc: Returns the name of detected object or avatar number.\nReturns the name of detected object number.\nReturns empty string if Number is not a valid index.

functions.name: llDetectedOwner
functions.doc: Returns the key of detected object's owner.\nReturns invalid key if Number is not a valid index.

functions.name: llDetectedPos
functions.doc: Returns the position of detected object or avatar number.\nReturns <0.0, 0.0, 0.0> if Number is not a valid index.

functions.name: llDetectedRot
functions.doc: Returns the rotation of detected object or avatar number.\nReturns <0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0> if Number is not a valid offset.

functions.name: llDetectedTouchBinormal

params.name: index
params.doc: Index of detection information

functions.doc: Returns the surface bi-normal for a triggered touch event.\nReturns a vector that is the surface bi-normal (tangent to the surface) where the touch event was triggered.

functions.name: llDetectedTouchFace

params.name: index
params.doc: Index of detection information

functions.doc: Returns the index of the face where the avatar clicked in a triggered touch event.

functions.name: llDetectedTouchNormal

params.name: index
params.doc: Index of detection information

functions.doc: Returns the surface normal for a triggered touch event.\nReturns a vector that is the surface normal (perpendicular to the surface) where the touch event was triggered.

functions.name: llDetectedTouchPos

params.name: index
params.doc: Index of detected information

functions.doc: Returns the position, in region coordinates, where the object was touched in a triggered touch event.\nUnless it is a HUD, in which case it returns the position relative to the attach point.

functions.name: llDetectedTouchST

params.name: index
params.doc: Index of detection information

functions.doc:
Returns a vector that is the surface coordinates where the prim was touched.
The X and Y vector positions contain the horizontal (S) and vertical (T) face coordinates respectively.
Each component is in the interval [0.0, 1.0].
TOUCH_INVALID_TEXCOORD is returned if the surface coordinates cannot be determined (e.g. when the viewer does not support this function).

functions.name: llDetectedTouchUV

params.name: index
params.doc: Index of detection information

functions.doc: Returns a vector that is the texture coordinates for where the prim was touched.\nThe X and Y vector positions contain the U and V face coordinates respectively.\nTOUCH_INVALID_TEXCOORD is returned if the touch UV coordinates cannot be determined (e.g. when the viewer does not support this function).

functions.name: llDetectedType
llDetectedVel
functions.doc: Returns the velocity of the detected object Number.\nReturns<0.0, 0.0, 0.0> if Number is not a valid offset.

functions.name: llDialog
functions.doc:
Shows a dialog box on the avatar's screen with the message.

				Up to 12 strings in the list form buttons.

				If a button is clicked, the name is chatted on Channel.
Opens a "notify box" in the given avatars screen displaying the message.

			Up to twelve buttons can be specified in a list of strings. When the user clicks a button, the name of the button is said on the specified channel.

			Channels work just like llSay(), so channel 0 can be heard by everyone.

			The chat originates at the object's position, not the avatar's position, even though it is said as the avatar (uses avatar's UUID and Name etc.).

			Examples:

			llDialog(who, "Are you a boy or a girl?", [ "Boy", "Girl" ], -4913);

			llDialog(who, "This shows only an OK button.", [], -192);

			llDialog(who, "This chats so you can 'hear' it.", ["Hooray"], 0);

functions.name: llDie
functions.doc: Delete the object which holds the script.

functions.name: llDumpList2String
functions.doc: Returns the list as a single string, using Separator between the entries.\nWrite the list out as a single string, using Separator between values.

functions.name: llEdgeOfWorld
functions.doc: Checks to see whether the border hit by Direction from Position is the edge of the world (has no neighboring region).\nReturns TRUE if the line along Direction from Position hits the edge of the world in the current simulator, returns FALSE if that edge crosses into another simulator.

functions.name: llEjectFromLand
functions.doc: Ejects AvatarID from land that you own.\nEjects AvatarID from land that the object owner (group or resident) owns.

functions.name: llEmail
functions.doc: Sends email to Address with Subject and Message.\nSends an email to Address with Subject and Message.

functions.name: llEscapeURL
functions.doc:
Returns an escaped/encoded version of url, replacing spaces with %20 etc.\nReturns the string that is the URL-escaped version of URL (replacing spaces with %20, etc.).\n
			This function returns the UTF-8 encoded escape codes for selected characters.

functions.name: llEuler2Rot
functions.doc: Returns the rotation representation of the Euler angles.\nReturns the rotation represented by the Euler Angle.

functions.name: llEvade

params.name: target
params.doc: Agent or object to evade.

params.name: options
params.doc: No options yet.

functions.doc: Evade a specified target.\nCharacters will (roughly) try to hide from their pursuers if there is a good hiding spot along their fleeing path. Hiding means no direct line of sight from the head of the character (centre of the top of its physics bounding box) to the head of its pursuer and no direct path between the two on the navigation-mesh.

functions.name: llExecCharacterCmd

params.name: command
params.doc: Command to send.

params.name: options
params.doc: Height for CHARACTER_CMD_JUMP.

functions.doc: Execute a character command.\nSend a command to the path system.\nCurrently only supports stopping the current path-finding operation or causing the character to jump.

functions.name: llFabs
functions.doc: Returns the positive version of Value.\nReturns the absolute value of Value.

functions.name: llFleeFrom

params.name: position
params.doc: Global coordinate from which to flee.

params.name: distance
params.doc: Distance in meters to flee from the source.

params.name: options
params.doc: No options available at this time.

functions.doc: Flee from a point.\nDirects a character (llCreateCharacter) to keep away from a defined position in the region or adjacent regions.

functions.name: llFloor
functions.doc: Returns largest integer value <= Value.

functions.name: llForceMouselook

params.name: mouselook
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE when an avatar sits on the prim, the avatar will be forced into mouse-look mode.\nFALSE is the default setting and will undo a previously set TRUE or do nothing.

functions.doc: If Enable is TRUE any avatar that sits on this object is forced into mouse-look mode.\nAfter calling this function with Enable set to TRUE, any agent sitting down on the prim will be forced into mouse-look.\nJust like llSitTarget, this changes a permanent property of the prim (not the object) and needs to be reset by calling this function with Enable set to FALSE in order to disable it.

functions.name: llForeach
functions.doc: walks through the Array name Returns 0 if array name does not exist and 1 otherwise.

functions.name: llFrand
functions.doc: Returns a pseudo random number in the range [0, Magnitude] or [Magnitude, 0].\nReturns a pseudo-random number between [0, Magnitude].

functions.name: llGenerateKey
functions.doc: Generates a key (SHA-1 hash) using UUID generation to create a unique key.\nAs the UUID produced is versioned, it should never return a value of NULL_KEY.\nThe specific UUID version is an implementation detail that has changed in the past and may change again in the future. Do not depend upon the UUID that is returned to be version 5 SHA-1 hash.

functions.name: llGetAccel
functions.doc: Returns the acceleration of the object relative to the region's axes.\nGets the acceleration of the object.

functions.name: llGetAgentInfo
functions.doc:
Returns an integer bit-field containing the agent information about id.\n
				Returns AGENT_FLYING, AGENT_ATTACHMENTS, AGENT_SCRIPTED, AGENT_SITTING, AGENT_ON_OBJECT, AGENT_MOUSELOOK, AGENT_AWAY, AGENT_BUSY, AGENT_TYPING, AGENT_CROUCHING, AGENT_ALWAYS_RUN, AGENT_WALKING and/or AGENT_IN_AIR.\nReturns information about the given agent ID as a bit-field of agent info constants.

functions.name: llGetAgentLanguage
functions.doc: Returns the language code of the preferred interface language of the avatar.\nReturns a string that is the language code of the preferred interface language of the resident.

functions.name: llGetAgentList

params.name: scope
params.doc: The scope (region, parcel, parcel same owner) to return agents for.

params.name: options
params.doc: List of options to apply. Current unused.

functions.doc: Requests a list of agents currently in the region, limited by the scope parameter.\nReturns a list [key UUID-0, key UUID-1, ..., key UUID-n] or [string error_msg] - returns avatar keys for all agents in the region limited to the area(s) specified by scope

functions.name: llGetAgentSize
functions.doc: If the avatar is in the same region, returns the size of the bounding box of the requested avatar by id, otherwise returns ZERO_VECTOR.\nIf the agent is in the same region as the object, returns the size of the avatar.

functions.name: llGetAlpha
functions.doc: Returns the alpha value of Face.\nReturns the 'alpha' of the given face. If face is ALL_SIDES the value returned is the mean average of all faces.

functions.name: llGetAndResetTime
functions.doc: Returns the script time in seconds and then resets the script timer to zero.\nGets the time in seconds since starting and resets the time to zero.

functions.name: llGetAnimation
functions.doc: Returns the name of the currently playing locomotion animation for the avatar id.\nReturns the currently playing animation for the specified avatar ID.

functions.name: llGetAnimationList
functions.doc: Returns a list of keys of playing animations for an avatar.\nReturns a list of keys of all playing animations for the specified avatar ID.

functions.name: llGetAnimationOverride
functions.doc: Returns a string that is the name of the animation that is used for the specified animation state\nTo use this function the script must obtain either the PERMISSION_OVERRIDE_ANIMATIONS or PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION permission (automatically granted to attached objects).

functions.name: llGetAttached
functions.doc: Returns the object's attachment point, or 0 if not attached.

functions.name: llGetAttachedList

params.name: avatar
params.doc: Avatar to get attachments

functions.doc: Returns a list of keys of all visible (not HUD) attachments on the avatar identified by the ID argument

functions.name: llGetBoundingBox
functions.doc: Returns the bounding box around the object (including any linked prims) relative to its root prim, as a list in the format [ (vector) min_corner, (vector) max_corner ].

functions.name: llGetCameraPos
functions.doc: Returns the current camera position for the agent the task has permissions for.\nReturns the position of the camera, of the user that granted the script PERMISSION_TRACK_CAMERA. If no user has granted the permission, it returns ZERO_VECTOR.

functions.name: llGetCameraRot
functions.doc: Returns the current camera orientation for the agent the task has permissions for. If no user has granted the PERMISSION_TRACK_CAMERA permission, returns ZERO_ROTATION.

functions.name: llGetCenterOfMass
functions.doc: Returns the prim's centre of mass (unless called from the root prim, where it returns the object's centre of mass).

functions.name: llGetClosestNavPoint

params.name: point
params.doc: A point in region-local space.

params.name: options
params.doc: No options at this time.

functions.doc: Get the closest navigable point to the point provided.\nThe function accepts a point in region-local space (like all the other path-finding methods) and returns either an empty list or a list containing a single vector which is the closest point on the navigation-mesh to the point provided.

functions.name: llGetColor
functions.doc: Returns the color on Face.\nReturns the color of Face as a vector of red, green, and blue values between 0 and 1. If face is ALL_SIDES the color returned is the mean average of each channel.

functions.name: llGetCreator
functions.doc: Returns a key for the creator of the prim.\nReturns the key of the object's original creator. Similar to llGetOwner.

functions.name: llGetDate
functions.doc: Returns the current date in the UTC time zone in the format YYYY-MM-DD.\nReturns the current UTC date as YYYY-MM-DD.

functions.name: llGetDisplayName

params.name: id
params.doc: Avatar UUID that is in the same region, or is otherwise known to the region.

functions.doc: Returns the display name of an avatar, if the avatar is connected to the current region, or if the name has been cached.  Otherwise, returns an empty string. Use llRequestDisplayName if the avatar may be absent from the region.

functions.name: llGetEnergy
functions.doc: Returns how much energy is in the object as a percentage of maximum.

functions.name: llGetEnv

params.name: name
params.doc: The type of data to request. Any other string will cause an empty string to be returned.

functions.doc: Returns a string with the requested data about the region.

functions.name: llGetExperienceDetails

params.name: experience_id
params.doc: May be NULL_KEY to retrieve the details for the script's Experience

functions.doc: Returns a list with the following Experience properties: [Experience Name, Owner ID, Group ID, Experience ID, State, State Message]. State is an integer corresponding to one of the constants XP_ERROR_... and State Message is the string returned by llGetExperienceErrorMessage for that integer.

functions.name: llGetExperienceErrorMessage

params.name: error
params.doc: An Experience error code to translate.

functions.doc: Returns a string describing the error code passed or the string corresponding with XP_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ERROR if the value is not a valid Experience error code.

functions.name: llGetForce
functions.doc: Returns the force (if the script is physical).\nReturns the current force if the script is physical.

functions.name: llGetFreeMemory
functions.doc: Returns the number of free bytes of memory the script can use.\nReturns the available free space for the current script. This is inaccurate with LSO.

functions.name: llGetFreeURLs

functions.name: llGroundRepel

params.name: height
params.doc: Distance above the ground.

params.name: water
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE then hover above water too.

params.name: tau
params.doc: Seconds to critically damp in.

functions.doc:
Critically damps to height if within height * 0.5 of level (either above ground level or above the higher of land and water if water == TRUE).
Critically damps to fHeight if within fHeight * 0.5 of ground or water level.

				The height is above ground level if iWater is FALSE or above the higher of land and water if iWater is TRUE.

				Do not use with vehicles. Only works in physics-enabled objects.

functions.name: llGroundSlope

functions.name: llHTTPRequest

params.name: url
params.doc: A valid HTTP/HTTPS URL.

params.name: parameters
params.doc: Configuration parameters, specified as HTTP_* flag-value pairs.

params.name: body
params.doc: Contents of the request.

functions.doc: When the HTTP_EXTENDED_ERROR parameter is TRUE, llHTTPRequest will return extended error information to the script through the http_response event. A detailed error explanation is returned as a JSON blob blob in the body of the event and an error code is provided through the HTTP status. The format of the JSON blob is described in detail in RFC 7807.

functions.name: llHTTPResponse

params.name: request_id
params.doc: A valid HTTP request key.

params.name: status
params.doc: HTTP Status (200, 400, 404, etc.).

params.name: body
params.doc: Contents of the response.

functions.doc: Responds to an incoming HTTP request which was triggerd by an http_request event within the script. HTTPRequestID specifies the request to respond to (this ID is supplied in the http_request event handler).  Status and Body specify the status code and message to respond with.

functions.name: llKey2Name

params.name: id
params.doc: Avatar or rezzed prim UUID.

functions.doc: Returns the name of the prim or avatar specified by ID. The ID must be a valid rezzed prim or avatar key in the current simulator, otherwise an empty string is returned.\nFor avatars, the returned name is the legacy name

functions.name: llKeyCountKeyValue
functions.doc: Starts an asychronous transaction the request the number of keys in the data store. The dataserver callback will be executed with the key returned from this call and a string describing the result. The result is commma-delimited list. The first item is an integer specifying if the transaction succeeded (1) or not (0). In the failure case, the second item will be an integer corresponding to one of the XP_ERROR_... constants. In the success case the second item will the the number of keys in the system.

functions.name: llKeysKeyValue

params.name: first
params.doc: Index of the first key to return.

params.name: count
params.doc: The number of keys to return.

functions.doc: Starts an asychronous transaction the request a number of keys from the data store. The dataserver callback will be executed with the key returned from this call and a string describing the result. The result is commma-delimited list. The first item is an integer specifying if the transaction succeeded (1) or not (0). In the failure case, the second item will be an integer corresponding to one of the XP_ERROR_... constants. The error XP_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND is returned if First is greater than or equal to the number of keys in the data store. In the success case the subsequent items will be the keys requested. The number of keys returned may be less than requested if the return value is too large or if there is not enough keys remaining. The order keys are returned is not guaranteed but is stable between subsequent calls as long as no keys are added or removed. Because the keys are returned in a comma-delimited list it is not recommended to use commas in key names if this function is used.

functions.name: llLinkParticleSystem

params.name: link
params.doc: Link number (0: unlinked, 1: root prim, >1: child prims) or a LINK_* flag

params.name: rules
params.doc: Particle system rules list in the format [ rule1, data1, rule2, data2 . . . ruleN, dataN ]

functions.doc: Creates a particle system in prim LinkNumber based on Rules. An empty list removes a particle system from object.\nList format is [ rule-1, data-1, rule-2, data-2 ... rule-n, data-n ].\nThis is identical to llParticleSystem except that it applies to a specified linked prim and not just the prim the script is in.

functions.name: llList2List
functions.doc: Returns a subset of entries from ListVariable, in a range specified by the Start and End indicies (inclusive).\nUsing negative numbers for Start and/or End causes the index to count backwards from the length of the string, so 0, -1 would capture the entire string.\nIf Start is greater than End, the sub string is the exclusion of the entries.

functions.name: llList2String

functions.name: llList2Vector
