functions.name: llListen
functions.doc: Creates a listen callback for Text on Channel from SpeakersName and SpeakersID (SpeakersName, SpeakersID, and/or Text can be empty) and returns an identifier that can be used to deactivate or remove the listen.\nNon-empty values for SpeakersName, SpeakersID, and Text will filter the results accordingly, while empty strings and NULL_KEY will not filter the results, for string and key parameters respectively.\nPUBLIC_CHANNEL is the public chat channel that all avatars see as chat text. DEBUG_CHANNEL is the script debug channel, and is also visible to nearby avatars. All other channels are are not sent to avatars, but may be used to communicate with scripts.

functions.name: llListenControl
functions.doc: Makes a listen event callback active or inactive. Pass in the value returned from llListen to the iChannelHandle parameter to specify which listener you are controlling.\nUse boolean values to specify Active

functions.name: llListenRemove
functions.doc: Removes a listen event callback. Pass in the value returned from llListen to the iChannelHandle parameter to specify which listener to remove.

functions.name: llListFindList
functions.doc: Returns the index of the first instance of Find in ListVariable. Returns -1 if not found.\nReturns the position of the first instance of the Find list in the ListVariable. Returns -1 if not found.

functions.name: llListInsertList
functions.doc: Returns a list that contains all the elements from Target but with the elements from ListVariable inserted at Position start.\nReturns a new list, created by inserting ListVariable into the Target list at Position. Note this does not alter the Target.

functions.name: llListRandomize
functions.doc: Returns a version of the input ListVariable which has been randomized by blocks of size Stride.\nIf the remainder from the length of the list, divided by the stride is non-zero, this function does not randomize the list.

functions.name: llListReplaceList
functions.doc: Returns a list that is Target with Start through End removed and ListVariable inserted at Start.\nReturns a list replacing the slice of the Target list from Start to End with the specified ListVariable. Start and End are inclusive, so 0, 1 would replace the first two entries and 0, 0 would replace only the first list entry.

functions.name: llListSort

params.name: src
params.doc: List to sort.

params.name: stride
params.doc: Stride length.

params.name: ascending
params.doc: Boolean. TRUE = result in ascending order, FALSE = result in descending order.

functions.doc: Returns the specified list, sorted into blocks of stride in ascending order (if Ascending is TRUE, otherwise descending). Note that sort only works if the first entry of each block is the same datatype.

functions.name: llListStatistics

params.name: operation
params.doc: One of LIST_STAT_* values

params.name: src
params.doc: Variable to analyze.

functions.doc: Performs a statistical aggregate function, specified by a LIST_STAT_* constant, on ListVariables.\nThis function allows a script to perform a statistical operation as defined by operation on a list composed of integers and floats.

functions.name: llLoadURL
functions.doc: Shows dialog to avatar AvatarID offering to load web page at URL.	If user clicks yes, launches their web browser.\nllLoadURL displays a dialogue box to the user, offering to load the specified web page using the default web browser.

functions.name: llLog
functions.doc: Returns the natural logarithm of Value. Returns zero if Value <= 0.\nReturns the base e (natural) logarithm of the specified Value.

functions.name: llLog10
functions.doc: Returns the base 10 logarithm of Value. Returns zero if Value <= 0.\nReturns the base 10 (common) logarithm of the specified Value.

functions.name: llLookAt
functions.doc: Cause object name to point its forward axis towards Target, at a force controlled by Strength and Damping.\nGood Strength values are around half the mass of the object and good Damping values are less than 1/10th of the Strength.\nAsymmetrical shapes require smaller Damping. A Strength of 0.0 cancels the look at.

functions.name: llLoopSound
functions.doc:
Plays specified Sound, looping indefinitely, at Volume (0.0 - 1.0).
Only one sound may be attached to an object at a time.
A second call to llLoopSound with the same key will not restart the sound, but the new volume will be used. This allows control over the volume of already playing sounds.
Setting the volume to 0 is not the same as calling llStopSound; a sound with 0 volume will continue to loop.
To restart the sound from the beginning, call llStopSound before calling llLoopSound again.

functions.name: llLoopSoundMaster
functions.doc: Plays attached Sound, looping at volume (0.0 - 1.0), and declares it a sync master.\nBehaviour is identical to llLoopSound, with the addition of marking the source as a "Sync Master", causing "Slave" sounds to sync to it. If there are multiple masters within a viewers interest area, the most audible one (a function of both distance and volume) will win out as the master.\nThe use of multiple masters within a small area is unlikely to produce the desired effect.

functions.name: llLoopSoundSlave
functions.doc:
Plays attached sound looping at volume (0.0 - 1.0), synced to most audible sync master.
Behaviour is identical to llLoopSound, unless there is a "Sync Master" present.
If a Sync Master is already playing the Slave sound will begin playing from the same point the master is in its loop synchronizing the loop points of both sounds.
If a Sync Master is started when the Slave is already playing, the Slave will skip to the correct position to sync with the Master.

functions.name: llMakeExplosion
functions.doc: Make a round explosion of particles. Deprecated: Use llParticleSystem instead.\nMake a round explosion of particles using texture from the objects inventory. Deprecated: Use llParticleSystem instead.

functions.name: llMakeFire
functions.doc: Make fire like particles. Deprecated: Use llParticleSystem instead.\nMake fire particles using texture from the objects inventory. Deprecated: Use llParticleSystem instead.

functions.name: llMakeFountain
functions.doc: Make a fountain of particles. Deprecated: Use llParticleSystem instead.\nMake a fountain of particles using texture from the objects inventory. Deprecated: Use llParticleSystem instead.

functions.name: llMakeSmoke
functions.doc: Make smoke like particles. Deprecated: Use llParticleSystem instead.\nMake smoky particles using texture from the objects inventory. Deprecated: Use llParticleSystem instead.

functions.name: llManageEstateAccess

params.name: action
params.doc: One of the ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_* actions.

params.name: avatar
params.doc: UUID of the avatar or group to act upon.

functions.doc: Adds or removes agents from the estate's agent access or ban lists, or groups to the estate's group access list. Action is one of the ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_* operations to perform.\nReturns an integer representing a boolean, TRUE if the call was successful; FALSE if throttled, invalid action, invalid or null id or object owner is not allowed to manage the estate.\nThe object owner is notified of any changes, unless PERMISSION_SILENT_ESTATE_MANAGEMENT has been granted to the script.

functions.name: llMapDestination
functions.doc: Opens world map for avatar who touched is is wearing the script, centred on RegionName with Position highlighted. Only works for scripts attached to avatar, or during touch events.\nDirection currently has no effect.

functions.name: llMD5String
functions.doc: Returns a string of 32 hex characters that is an RSA Data Security Inc., MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm of Text with Nonce used as the salt.\nReturns a 32-character hex string. (128-bit in binary.)

functions.name: llMessageLinked
functions.doc: Sends Number, Text, and ID to members of the link set identified by LinkNumber.\nLinkNumber is either a linked number (available through llGetLinkNumber) or a LINK_* constant.

functions.name: llMinEventDelay
functions.doc: Set the minimum time between events being handled.

functions.name: llModifyLand

params.name: action
params.doc: LAND_LEVEL, LAND_RAISE, LAND_LOWER, LAND_SMOOTH, LAND_NOISE or LAND_REVERT

params.name: brush
params.doc: 0, 1, 2 (2m x 2m, 4m x 4m, or 8m x 8m)

functions.doc: Modify land with action (LAND_LEVEL, LAND_RAISE, LAND_LOWER, LAND_SMOOTH, LAND_NOISE, LAND_REVERT) on size (0, 1, 2, corresponding to 2m x 2m, 4m x 4m, 8m x 8m).

functions.name: llModPow
functions.doc: Returns a Value raised to the Power, mod Modulus. ((a**b)%c) b is capped at 0xFFFF (16 bits).\nReturns (Value ^ Power) % Modulus. (Value raised to the Power, Modulus). Value is capped at 0xFFFF (16 bits).

functions.name: llMoveToTarget
functions.doc: Critically damp to Target in Tau seconds (if the script is physical).\nCritically damp to position target in tau-seconds if the script is physical. Good tau-values are greater than 0.2. A tau of 0.0 stops the critical damping.

functions.name: llNavigateTo

params.name: pos
params.doc: Region coordinates for the character to navigate to.

params.name: options
params.doc: List of parameters to control the type of path-finding used. Currently only FORCE_DIRECT_PATH supported.

functions.doc: Navigate to destination.\nDirects an object to travel to a defined position in the region or adjacent regions.

functions.name: llOffsetTexture
functions.doc: Sets the texture S and T offsets for the chosen Face.\nIf Face is ALL_SIDES this function sets the texture offsets for all faces.

functions.name: llOpenRemoteDataChannel
functions.doc: Requests a channel to listen for XML-RPC calls. (Deprecated: XML-RPC should not be used. Use http-in instead.)\nWill trigger a remote_data event with type = REMOTE_DATA_CHANNEL and a channel ID (key) once it is available.\nThis channel ID must be referenced in the XML-RPC call to the script (from the internet) -- so the key must somehow get to the external XML-RPC client.

functions.name: llOverMyLand
functions.doc: Returns TRUE if id ID over land owned by the script owner, otherwise FALSE.\nReturns TRUE if key ID is over land owned by the object owner, FALSE otherwise.

functions.name: llOwnerSay
functions.doc: says Text to owner only (if owner is in region).\nSays Text to the owner of the object running the script, if the owner has been within the object's simulator since logging into Second Life, regardless of where they may be in-world.

functions.name: llParcelMediaCommandList

params.name: commandList
params.doc: A list of PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_* flags and their parameters

functions.doc: Controls the playback of multimedia resources on a parcel or for an agent, via one or more PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_* arguments specified in CommandList.

functions.name: llParcelMediaQuery
functions.doc: Queries the media properties of the parcel containing the script, via one or more PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_* arguments specified in CommandList.\nThis function will only work if the script is contained within an object owned by the land-owner (or if the land is owned by a group, only if the object has been deeded to the group).

functions.name: llParseString2List
functions.doc: Converts Text into a list, discarding Separators, keeping Spacers (Separators and Spacers must be lists of strings, maximum of 8 each).\nSeparators and Spacers are lists of strings with a maximum of 8 entries each.

functions.name: llParseStringKeepNulls
functions.doc: Breaks Text into a list, discarding separators, keeping spacers, keeping any null values generated. (separators and spacers must be lists of strings, maximum of 8 each).\nllParseStringKeepNulls works almost exactly like llParseString2List, except that if a null is found it will add a null-string instead of discarding it like llParseString2List does.

functions.name: llParticleSystem
functions.doc: Creates a particle system in the prim the script is attached to, based on Parameters. An empty list removes a particle system from object.\nList format is [ rule-1, data-1, rule-2, data-2 ... rule-n, data-n ].

functions.name: llPassCollisions

params.name: pass
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE, collisions are passed from children on to parents.

functions.doc: Configures how collision events are passed to scripts in the linkset.\nIf Pass == TRUE, collisions involving collision-handling scripted child prims are also passed on to the root prim. If Pass == FALSE (default behavior), such collisions will only trigger events in the affected child prim.

functions.name: llPassTouches

params.name: pass
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE, touches are passed from children on to parents.

functions.doc: Configures how touch events are passed to scripts in the linkset.\nIf Pass == TRUE, touches involving touch-handling scripted child prims are also passed on to the root prim. If Pass == FALSE (default behavior), such touches will only trigger events in the affected child prim.

functions.name: llPatrolPoints

params.name: patrolPoints
params.doc: A list of vectors for the character to travel through sequentially. The list must contain at least two entries.

params.name: options
params.doc: No options available at this time.

functions.doc: Patrol a list of points.\nSets the points for a character (llCreateCharacter) to patrol along.

functions.name: llPlaySound
functions.doc:
Plays Sound once, at Volume (0.0 - 1.0) and attached to the object.
Only one sound may be attached to an object at a time, and attaching a new sound or calling llStopSound will stop the previously attached sound.
A second call to llPlaySound with the same sound will not restart the sound, but the new volume will be used, which allows control over the volume of already playing sounds.
To restart the sound from the beginning, call llStopSound before calling llPlaySound again.

functions.name: llPlaySoundSlave
functions.doc: Plays attached Sound once, at Volume (0.0 - 1.0), synced to next loop of most audible sync master.\nBehaviour is identical to llPlaySound, unless there is a "Sync Master" present. If a Sync Master is already playing, the Slave sound will not be played until the Master hits its loop point and returns to the beginning.\nllPlaySoundSlave will play the sound exactly once; if it is desired to have the sound play every time the Master loops, either use llLoopSoundSlave with extra silence padded on the end of the sound or ensure that llPlaySoundSlave is called at least once per loop of the Master.

functions.name: llPow
functions.doc: Returns the Value raised to the power Exponent, or returns 0 and triggers Math Error for imaginary results.\nReturns the Value raised to the Exponent.

functions.name: llPreloadSound
functions.doc: Causes nearby viewers to preload the Sound from the object's inventory.\nThis is intended to prevent delays in starting new sounds when called upon.

functions.name: llPursue

params.name: target
params.doc: Agent or object to pursue.

params.name: options
params.doc: Parameters for pursuit.

functions.doc: Chase after a target.\nCauses the character (llCharacter) to pursue the target defined by TargetID.

functions.name: llPushObject
functions.doc: Applies Impulse and AngularImpulse to ObjectID.\nApplies the supplied impulse and angular impulse to the object specified.

functions.name: llReadKeyValue
functions.doc: Starts an asychronous transaction to retrieve the value associated with the key given. Will fail with XP_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND if the key does not exist. The dataserver callback will be executed with the key returned from this call and a string describing the result. The result is a two element commma-delimited list. The first item is an integer specifying if the transaction succeeded (1) or not (0). In the failure case, the second item will be an integer corresponding to one of the XP_ERROR_... constants. In the success case the second item will be the value associated with the key.

functions.name: llRefreshPrimURL
functions.doc: Reloads the web page shown on the sides of the object.

functions.name: llRegionSay

params.name: channel
params.doc: Any integer value except zero.

params.name: msg
params.doc: Message to be transmitted.

functions.doc: Broadcasts Text to entire region on Channel (except for channel 0).

functions.name: llRegionSayTo

params.name: target
params.doc: Avatar or object to say to.

params.name: channel
params.doc: Output channel, any integer value.

params.name: msg
params.doc: Message to be transmitted.

functions.doc: Says Text, on Channel, to avatar or object indicated by TargetID (if within region).\nIf TargetID is an avatar and Channel is nonzero, Text can be heard by any attachment on the avatar.

functions.name: llReleaseCamera
functions.doc: Return camera to agent.\nDeprecated: Use llClearCameraParams instead.

functions.name: llReleaseControls
functions.doc: Stop taking inputs.\nStop taking inputs from the avatar.

functions.name: llReleaseURL

params.name: url
params.doc: URL to release.

functions.doc: Releases the specified URL, which was previously obtained using llRequestURL.  Once released, the URL will no longer be usable.

functions.name: llRemoteDataReply

params.name: sdata
params.doc: String data to send

params.name: idata
params.doc: Integer data to send

functions.doc: Send an XML-RPC reply to MessageID on ChannelID with payload of string sData and integer iData. Deprecated: Use HTTP functions/events instead.\nThe size of sData is limited to 254 characters.

functions.name: llRemoteDataSetRegion
functions.doc: Deprecated: Use HTTP functions/events instead.\nIf an object using remote data channels changes regions, you must call this function to re-register the remote data channels.\nYou do not need to make this call if you don't change regions.

functions.name: llRemoteLoadScriptPin

params.name: target
params.doc: Target prim to attempt copying into.

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the script in current inventory to copy.

params.name: pin
params.doc: Integer set on target prim as a Personal Information Number code.

params.name: running
params.doc: If the script should be set running in the target prim.

params.name: start_param
params.doc: Integer. Parameter passed to the script if set to be running.

functions.doc: If the owner of the object containing this script can modify the object identified by the specified object key, and if the PIN matches the PIN previously set using llSetRemoteScriptAccessPin (on the target prim), then the script will be copied into target. Running is a boolean specifying whether the script should be enabled once copied into the target object.

functions.name: llRemoveFromLandBanList
functions.doc: Remove avatar from the land ban list.\nRemove specified avatar from the land parcel ban list.

functions.name: llRemoveFromLandPassList
functions.doc: Remove avatar from the land pass list.\nRemove specified avatar from the land parcel pass list.

functions.name: llRemoveInventory
functions.doc: Remove the named inventory item.\nRemove the named inventory item from the object inventory.

functions.name: llRemoveVehicleFlags
functions.doc: Removes the enabled bits in 'flags'.\nSets the vehicle flags to FALSE. Valid parameters can be found in the vehicle flags constants section.

functions.name: llRequestAgentData
functions.doc: Requests data about AvatarID. When data is available the dataserver event will be raised.\nThis function requests data about an avatar. If and when the information is collected, the dataserver event is triggered with the key returned from this function passed in the requested parameter. See the agent data constants (DATA_*) for details about valid values of data and what each will return in the dataserver event.

functions.name: llRequestDisplayName

params.name: id
params.doc: Avatar UUID

functions.doc: Requests the display name of the agent. When the display name is available the dataserver event will be raised.\nThe avatar identified does not need to be in the same region or online at the time of the request.\nReturns a key that is used to identify the dataserver event when it is raised.

functions.name: llRequestExperiencePermissions

params.name: name
params.doc: Not used, should be ""

functions.doc: Ask the agent for permission to participate in an experience. This request is similar to llRequestPermissions with the following permissions: PERMISSION_TAKE_CONTROLS, PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION, PERMISSION_ATTACH, PERMISSION_TRACK_CAMERA, PERMISSION_CONTROL_CAMERA and PERMISSION_TELEPORT. However, unlike llRequestPermissions the decision to allow or block the request is persistent and applies to all scripts using the experience grid wide. Subsequent calls to llRequestExperiencePermissions from scripts in the experience will receive the same response automatically with no user interaction. One of experience_permissions or experience_permissions_denied will be generated in response to this call. Outstanding permission requests will be lost if the script is derezzed, moved to another region or reset.

functions.name: llRequestInventoryData
functions.doc: Requests data for the named InventoryItem.\nWhen data is available, the dataserver event will be raised with the key returned from this function in the requested parameter.\nThe only request currently implemented is to request data from landmarks, where the data returned is in the form "<float, float, float>" which can be cast to a vector. This position is in region local coordinates.

functions.name: llRequestPermissions
functions.doc: Ask AvatarID to allow the script to perform certain actions, specified in the PermissionMask bitmask. PermissionMask should be one or more PERMISSION_* constants. Multiple permissions can be requested simultaneously by ORing the constants together. Many of the permissions requests can only go to object owner.\nThis call will not stop script execution. If the avatar grants the requested permissions, the run_time_permissions event will be called.

functions.name: llRequestSecureURL
functions.doc: Requests one HTTPS:// (SSL) URL for use by this object. The http_request event is triggered with results.\nReturns a key that is the handle used for identifying the request in the http_request event.

functions.name: llRequestSimulatorData
functions.doc: Requests the specified Data about RegionName. When the specified data is available, the dataserver event is raised.\nData should use one of the DATA_SIM_* constants.\nReturns a dataserver query ID and triggers the dataserver event when data is found.

functions.name: llRequestURL
functions.doc: Requests one HTTP:// URL for use by this script. The http_request event is triggered with the result of the request.\nReturns a key that is the handle used for identifying the result in the http_request event.

functions.name: llRequestUsername
functions.doc:
Requests single-word user-name of an avatar. When data is available the dataserver event will be raised.
Requests the user-name of the identified agent. When the user-name is available the dataserver event is raised.
The agent identified does not need to be in the same region or online at the time of the request.
Returns a key that is used to identify the dataserver event when it is raised.

functions.name: llResetAnimationOverride
functions.doc: Resets the animation of the specified animation state to the default value.\nIf animation state equals "ALL", then all animation states are reset.

functions.name: llResetLandBanList
functions.doc: Removes all residents from the land ban list.

functions.name: llResetLandPassList
functions.doc: Removes all residents from the land access/pass list.

functions.name: llResetOtherScript
functions.doc: Resets the named script.

functions.name: llResetScript
functions.doc: Resets the script.

functions.name: llResetTime
functions.doc: Sets the time to zero.\nSets the internal timer to zero.

functions.name: llReturnObjectsByID

params.name: objects
params.doc: List of object UUIDs to be returned.

functions.doc: Return objects using their UUIDs.\nRequires the PERMISSION_RETURN_OBJECTS permission and that the script owner owns the parcel the returned objects are in, or is an estate manager or region owner.

functions.name: llReturnObjectsByOwner

params.name: owner
params.doc: Object owner's UUID.

functions.doc: Return objects based upon their owner and a scope of parcel, parcel owner, or region.\nRequires the PERMISSION_RETURN_OBJECTS permission and that the script owner owns the parcel the returned objects are in, or is an estate manager or region owner.

functions.name: llRezAtRoot
functions.doc: Instantiate owner's InventoryItem at Position with Velocity, Rotation and with StartParameter. The last selected root object's location will be set to Position.\nCreates object's inventory item at the given Position, with Velocity, Rotation, and StartParameter.

functions.name: llRezObject
functions.doc: Instantiate owners InventoryItem at Position with Velocity, Rotation and with start StartParameter.\nCreates object's inventory item at Position with Velocity and Rotation supplied. The StartParameter value will be available to the newly created object in the on_rez event or through the llGetStartParameter function.\nThe Velocity parameter is ignored if the rezzed object is not physical.

functions.name: llRot2Angle
functions.doc: Returns the rotation angle represented by Rotation.\nReturns the angle represented by the Rotation.

functions.name: llRot2Axis
functions.doc: Returns the rotation axis represented by Rotation.\nReturns the axis represented by the Rotation.

functions.name: llRot2Euler
functions.doc: Returns the Euler representation (roll, pitch, yaw) of Rotation.\nReturns the Euler Angle representation of the Rotation.

functions.name: llRot2Fwd
functions.doc: Returns the forward vector defined by Rotation.\nReturns the forward axis represented by the Rotation.

functions.name: llRot2Left
functions.doc: Returns the left vector defined by Rotation.\nReturns the left axis represented by the Rotation.

functions.name: llRot2Up
functions.doc: Returns the up vector defined by Rotation.\nReturns the up axis represented by the Rotation.

functions.name: llRotateTexture
functions.doc: Sets the texture rotation for the specified Face to angle Radians.\nIf Face is ALL_SIDES, rotates the texture of all sides.

functions.name: llRotBetween
functions.doc: Returns the rotation to rotate Vector1 to Vector2.\nReturns the rotation needed to rotate Vector1 to Vector2.

functions.name: llRotLookAt
functions.doc: Cause object to rotate to Rotation, with a force function defined by Strength and Damping parameters. Good strength values are around half the mass of the object and good damping values are less than 1/10th of the strength.\nAsymmetrical shapes require smaller damping.\nA strength of 0.0 cancels the look at.

functions.name: llRotTarget
functions.doc: Set rotations with error of LeeWay radians as a rotational target, and return an ID for the rotational target.\nThe returned number is a handle that can be used in at_rot_target and llRotTargetRemove.

functions.name: llRotTargetRemove
functions.doc: Removes rotational target number.\nRemove rotational target indicated by the handle.

functions.name: llRound
functions.doc: Returns Value rounded to the nearest integer.\nReturns the Value rounded to the nearest integer.

functions.name: llSameGroup
functions.doc: Returns TRUE if avatar ID is in the same region and has the same active group, otherwise FALSE.\nReturns TRUE if the object or agent identified is in the same simulator and has the same active group as this object. Otherwise, returns FALSE.

functions.name: llSay

params.name: channel
params.doc: Channel to use to say text on.

params.name: msg
params.doc: Text to say.

functions.doc: Says Text on Channel.\nThis chat method has a range of 20m radius.\nPUBLIC_CHANNEL is the public chat channel that all avatars see as chat text. DEBUG_CHANNEL is the script debug channel, and is also visible to nearby avatars. All other channels are are not sent to avatars, but may be used to communicate with scripts.

functions.name: llScaleByFactor

params.name: scaling_factor
params.doc: The multiplier to be used with the prim sizes and their local positions.

functions.doc:
Attempts to resize the entire object by ScalingFactor, maintaining the size-position ratios of the prims.

Resizing is subject to prim scale limits and linkability limits. This function can not resize the object if the linkset is physical, a pathfinding character, in a keyframed motion, or if resizing would cause the parcel to overflow.
Returns a boolean (an integer) TRUE if it succeeds, FALSE if it fails.

functions.name: llScaleTexture
functions.doc: Sets the diffuse texture Horizontal and Vertical repeats on Face of the prim the script is attached to.\nIf Face == ALL_SIDES, all sides are set in one call.\nNegative values for horizontal and vertical will flip the texture.

functions.name: llScriptDanger
functions.doc: Returns TRUE if Position is over public land, sandbox land, land that doesn't allow everyone to edit and build, or land that doesn't allow outside scripts.\nReturns true if the position is over public land, land that doesn't allow everyone to edit and build, or land that doesn't allow outside scripts.

functions.name: llScriptProfiler

params.name: flags
params.doc: PROFILE_NONE or PROFILE_SCRIPT_MEMORY flags to control the state.

functions.doc: Enables or disables script profiling options. Currently only supports PROFILE_SCRIPT_MEMORY (Mono only) and PROFILE_NONE.\nMay significantly reduce script performance.

functions.name: llSendRemoteData
functions.doc: Deprecated: use HTTP functions and events instead.\nSends an XML-RPC request to Destination through ChannelID with payload of ChannelID (in a string), integer Value and string Text.\nReturns a key that is the message_id for the resulting remote_data events.

functions.name: llSensor

params.name: name
params.doc: Object or avatar name.

params.name: id
params.doc: Object or avatar UUID.

params.name: type
params.doc: Bit-field mask of AGENT, AGENT_BY_LEGACY_NAME, AGENT_BY_USERNAME, ACTIVE, PASSIVE, and/or SCRIPTED

params.name: radius
params.doc: Distance to scan. 0.0 - 96.0m.

params.name: arc
params.doc: Angle, in radians, from the local x-axis of the prim to scan.

functions.doc: Performs a single scan for Name and ID with Type (AGENT, ACTIVE, PASSIVE, and/or SCRIPTED) within Range meters and Arc radians of forward vector.\nSpecifying a blank Name, 0 Type, or NULL_KEY ID will prevent filtering results based on that parameter. A range of 0.0 does not perform a scan.\nResults are returned in the sensor and no_sensor events.

functions.name: llSensorRemove
functions.doc: removes sensor.\nRemoves the sensor set by llSensorRepeat.

functions.name: llSensorRepeat

params.name: name
params.doc: Object or avatar name.

params.name: id
params.doc: Object or avatar UUID.

params.name: type
params.doc: Bit-field mask of AGENT, AGENT_BY_LEGACY_NAME, AGENT_BY_USERNAME, ACTIVE, PASSIVE, and/or SCRIPTED

params.name: radius
params.doc: Distance to scan. 0.0 - 96.0m.

params.name: arc
params.doc: Angle, in radians, from the local x-axis of the prim to scan.

params.name: rate
params.doc: Period, in seconds, between scans.

functions.doc: Initiates a periodic scan every Rate seconds, for Name and ID with Type (AGENT, ACTIVE, PASSIVE, and/or SCRIPTED) within Range meters and Arc radians of forward vector.\nSpecifying a blank Name, 0 Type, or NULL_KEY ID will prevent filtering results based on that parameter. A range of 0.0 does not perform a scan.\nResults are returned in the sensor and no_sensor events.

functions.name: llSetAlpha
functions.doc: Sets the alpha (opacity) of Face.\nSets the alpha (opacity) value for Face. If Face is ALL_SIDES, sets the alpha for all faces. The alpha value is interpreted as an opacity percentage (1.0 is fully opaque, and 0.2 is mostly transparent). This function will clamp alpha values less than 0.1 to 0.1 and greater than 1.0 to 1.

functions.name: llSetAngularVelocity

params.name: initial_omega
params.doc: The angular velocity to set the object to.

params.name: local
params.doc: If TRUE, the AngVel is treated as a local directional vector instead of a regional directional vector.

functions.doc: Sets an object's angular velocity to AngVel, in local coordinates if Local == TRUE (if the script is physical).\nHas no effect on non-physical objects.

functions.name: llSetAnimationOverride
functions.doc: Sets the animation (in object inventory) that will play for the given animation state.\nTo use this function the script must obtain the PERMISSION_OVERRIDE_ANIMATIONS permission.

functions.name: llSetBuoyancy
functions.doc: Set the tasks buoyancy (0 is none, < 1.0 sinks, 1.0 floats, > 1.0 rises).\nSet the object buoyancy. A value of 0 is none, less than 1.0 sinks, 1.0 floats, and greater than 1.0 rises.

functions.name: llSetCameraAtOffset
functions.doc: Sets the camera used in this object, at offset, if an avatar sits on it.\nSets the offset that an avatar's camera will be moved to if the avatar sits on the object.

functions.name: llSetCameraEyeOffset
functions.doc: Sets the camera eye offset used in this object if an avatar sits on it.

functions.name: llSetCameraParams
functions.doc: Sets multiple camera parameters at once. List format is [ rule-1, data-1, rule-2, data-2 . . . rule-n, data-n ].

functions.name: llSetClickAction

params.name: action
params.doc: A CLICK_ACTION_* flag

functions.doc: Sets the action performed when a prim is clicked upon.

functions.name: llSetColor
functions.doc: Sets the color, for the face.\nSets the color of the side specified. If Face is ALL_SIDES, sets the color on all faces.

functions.name: llSetContentType

params.name: request_id
params.doc: A valid http_request() key

params.name: content_type
params.doc: Media type to use with any following llHTTPResponse(HTTPRequestID, ...)

functions.doc: Set the media type of an LSL HTTP server response to ContentType.\nHTTPRequestID must be a valid http_request ID. ContentType must be one of the CONTENT_TYPE_* constants.

functions.name: llSetDamage
functions.doc: Sets the amount of damage that will be done to an avatar that this task hits.	Task will be killed.\nSets the amount of damage that will be done to an avatar that this object hits. This object will be destroyed on damaging an avatar, and no collision event is triggered.

functions.name: llSetForce

params.name: force
params.doc: Directional force.

params.name: local
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE uses local axis, if FALSE uses region axis.

functions.doc: Sets Force on object, in object-local coordinates if Local == TRUE (otherwise, the region reference frame is used).\nOnly works on physical objects.

functions.name: llSetForceAndTorque

params.name: force
params.doc: Directional force.

params.name: torque
params.doc: Torque force.

params.name: local
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE uses local axis, if FALSE uses region axis.

functions.doc: Sets the Force and Torque of object, in object-local coordinates if Local == TRUE (otherwise, the region reference frame is used).\nOnly works on physical objects.

functions.name: llSetHoverHeight

params.name: height
params.doc: Distance above the ground.

params.name: water
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE then hover above water too.

params.name: tau
params.doc: Seconds to critically damp in.

functions.doc: Critically damps a physical object to a Height (either above ground level or above the higher of land and water if water == TRUE).\nDo not use with vehicles. Use llStopHover to stop hovering.

functions.name: llSetInventoryPermMask

params.name: item
params.doc: An item in the prim's inventory

params.name: category
params.doc: MASK_* flag

params.name: value
params.doc: Permission bit-field (PERM_* flags)

functions.doc: Sets the given permission mask to the new value on the inventory item.

functions.name: llSetKeyframedMotion

params.name: keyframes
params.doc: Strided keyframe list of the form: position, orientation, time. Each keyframe is interpreted relative to the previous transform of the object.

functions.doc: Requests that a non-physical object be key-framed according to key-frame list.\nSpecify a list of times, positions, and orientations to be followed by an object. The object will be smoothly moved between key-frames by the simulator. Collisions with other non-physical or key-framed objects will be ignored (no script events will fire and collision processing will not occur). Collisions with physical objects will be computed and reported, but the key-framed object will be unaffected by those collisions.\nKeyframes is a strided list containing positional, rotational, and time data for each step in the motion.  Options is a list containing optional arguments and parameters (specified by KFM_* constants).

functions.name: llSetLinkAlpha
functions.doc: If a prim exists in the link chain at LinkNumber, set Face to Opacity.\nSets the Face, on the linked prim specified, to the Opacity.

functions.name: llSetLinkCamera

params.name: link
params.doc: Prim link number (0: unlinked, 1: root prim, >1: child prims) or a LINK_* flag

params.name: eye
params.doc: Offset, relative to the object's centre and expressed in local coordinates, that the camera looks from.

params.name: at
params.doc: Offset, relative to the object's centre and expressed in local coordinates, that the camera looks toward.

functions.doc: Sets the camera eye offset, and the offset that camera is looking at, for avatars that sit on the linked prim.

functions.name: llSetLinkColor

params.name: link
params.doc: Link number (0: unlinked, 1: root prim, >1: child prims) or a LINK_* flag.

params.name: color
params.doc: Color in RGB <R.R, G.G, B.B>

params.name: face
params.doc: Side number or ALL_SIDES.

functions.doc: If a task exists in the link chain at LinkNumber, set the Face to color.\nSets the color of the linked child's side, specified by LinkNumber.

functions.name: llSetLinkGLTFOverrides
functions.doc: Passing an empty string ("") as the override value will clear that override.

functions.name: llSetLinkMedia

params.name: link
params.doc: Link number (0: unlinked, 1: root prim, >1: child prims).

params.name: face
params.doc: Face number.

params.name: params
params.doc: A set of name/value pairs (in no particular order)

functions.doc: Set the media parameters for a particular face on linked prim, specified by Link. Returns an integer that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation(s).\nMediaParameters is a set of name/value pairs in no particular order. Parameters not specified are unchanged, or if new media is added then set to the default specified.

functions.name: llSetLinkPrimitiveParams

params.name: link
params.doc: Link number (0: unlinked, 1: root prim, >1: child prims) or a LINK_* flag

functions.doc: Set primitive parameters for LinkNumber based on Parameters.\nSets the parameters (or properties) of any linked prim in one step.

functions.name: llSetLinkPrimitiveParamsFast

params.name: link
params.doc: Link number (0: unlinked, 1: root prim, >1: child prims) or a LINK_* flag

functions.doc: Set primitive parameters for LinkNumber based on Parameters, without a delay.\nSet parameters for link number, from the list of Parameters, with no built-in script sleep. This function is identical to llSetLinkPrimitiveParams, except without the delay.

functions.name: llSetLinkTexture
functions.doc: Sets the Texture of Face on a linked prim, specified by LinkNumber. Texture may be a UUID or name of a texture in prim inventory.

functions.name: llSetLinkTextureAnim

params.name: link
params.doc: Link number (0: unlinked, 1: root prim, >1: child prims) or a LINK_* flag to effect

params.name: mode
params.doc: Bitmask of animation options.

params.name: face
params.doc: Specifies which object face to animate or ALL_SIDES.

params.name: sizex
params.doc: Horizontal frames (ignored for ROTATE and SCALE).

params.name: sizey
params.doc: Vertical frames (ignored for ROTATE and SCALE).

params.name: start
params.doc: Start position/frame number (or radians for ROTATE).

params.name: length
params.doc: Specifies the animation duration, in frames (or radians for ROTATE).

params.name: rate
params.doc: Specifies the animation playback rate, in frames per second (must be greater than zero).

functions.doc:
Animates a texture on the prim specified by LinkNumber, by setting the texture scale and offset.
Mode is a bitmask of animation options.
Face specifies which object face to animate.
SizeX and SizeY specify the number of horizontal and vertical frames.Start specifes the animation start point.
Length specifies the animation duration.
Rate specifies the animation playback rate.

functions.name: llSetLocalRot
functions.doc: Sets the rotation of a child prim relative to the root prim.

functions.name: llSetMemoryLimit

params.name: limit
params.doc: The amount to reserve, which must be less than the allowed maximum (currently 64KB) and not already have been exceeded.

functions.doc: Requests Limit bytes to be reserved for this script.\nReturns TRUE or FALSE indicating whether the limit was set successfully.\nThis function has no effect if the script is running in the LSO VM.

functions.name: llSetObjectDesc
functions.doc: Sets the description of the prim to Description.\nThe description field is limited to 127 characters.

functions.name: llSetObjectName
functions.doc: Sets the prim's name to Name.

functions.name: llSetObjectPermMask

params.name: mask
params.doc: MASK_* flag

params.name: value
params.doc: Permission bit-field (PERM_* flags)

functions.doc: Sets the specified PermissionFlag permission to the value specified by PermissionMask on the object the script is attached to.

functions.name: llSetParcelMusicURL
functions.doc: Sets the streaming audio URL for the parcel the object is on.\nThe object must be owned by the owner of the parcel; if the parcel is group owned the object must be owned by that group.

functions.name: llSetPayPrice

params.name: price
params.doc: The default price shown in the textu input field.

params.name: quick_pay_buttons
params.doc: Specifies the 4 payment values shown in the payment dialog's buttons (or PAY_HIDE).

functions.doc: Sets the default amount when someone chooses to pay this object.\nPrice is the default price shown in the textu input field.  QuickButtons specifies the 4 payment values shown in the payment dialog's buttons.\nInput field and buttons may be hidden with PAY_HIDE constant, and may be set to their default values using PAY_DEFAULT.

functions.name: llSetPhysicsMaterial

params.name: mask
params.doc: A bitmask specifying which of the parameters in the other arguments should be applied to the object.

functions.doc: Sets the selected parameters of the object's physics behavior.\nMaterialBits is a bitmask specifying which of the parameters in the other arguments should be applied to the object. GravityMultiplier, Restitution, Friction, and Density are the possible parameters to manipulate.

functions.name: llSetPos

params.name: pos
params.doc: Region coordinates to move to (within 10m).

functions.doc: If the object is not physical, this function sets the position of the prim.\nIf the script is in a child prim, Position is treated as root relative and the link-set is adjusted.\nIf the prim is the root prim, the entire object is moved (up to 10m) to Position in region coordinates.

functions.name: llSetPrimitiveParams

params.name: rules
params.doc: A list of changes.

functions.doc: This function changes the many properties (or "parameters") of a prim in one operation. Parameters is a list of changes.

functions.name: llSetPrimMediaParams

params.name: face
params.doc: Face number

params.name: params
params.doc: A set of name/value pairs (in no particular order)

functions.doc: Sets the MediaParameters for a particular Face on the prim. Returns an integer that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation(s).\nMediaParameters is a set of name/value pairs in no particular order. Parameters not specified are unchanged, or if new media is added then set to the default specified.

functions.name: llSetPrimURL
functions.doc: Deprecated: Use llSetPrimMediaParams instead.

functions.name: llSetRegionPos

params.name: position
params.doc: Vector. The location to move to, in region coordinates.

functions.doc:
Attempts to move the object so that the root prim is within 0.1m of Position.
Returns an integer boolean, TRUE if the object is successfully placed within 0.1 m of Position, FALSE otherwise.
Position may be any location within the region or up to 10m across a region border.
If the position is below ground, it will be set to the ground level at that x,y location.

functions.name: llSetRemoteScriptAccessPin
functions.doc: If PIN is set to a non-zero number, the task will accept remote script loads via llRemoteLoadScriptPin() if it passes in the correct PIN. Othersise, llRemoteLoadScriptPin() is ignored.

functions.name: llSetRot
functions.doc: If the object is not physical, this function sets the rotation of the prim.\nIf the script is in a child prim, Rotation is treated as root relative and the link-set is adjusted.\nIf the prim is the root prim, the entire object is rotated to Rotation in the global reference frame.

functions.name: llSetScale
functions.doc: Sets the prim's scale (size) to Scale.

functions.name: llSetScriptState
functions.doc: Enable or disable the script Running state of Script in the prim.

functions.name: llSetSitText
functions.doc: Displays Text rather than 'Sit' in the viewer's context menu.

functions.name: llSetSoundQueueing

params.name: queue
params.doc: Boolean, sound queuing: TRUE enables, FALSE disables (default).

functions.doc: Sets whether successive calls to llPlaySound, llLoopSound, etc., (attached sounds) interrupt the currently playing sound.\nThe default for objects is FALSE. Setting this value to TRUE will make the sound wait until the current playing sound reaches its end. The queue is one level deep.

functions.name: llSetSoundRadius

params.name: radius
params.doc: Maximum distance that sounds can be heard.

functions.doc: Limits radius for audibility of scripted sounds (both attached and triggered) to distance Radius.

functions.name: llSetStatus
functions.doc: Sets object status specified in Status bitmask (e.g. STATUS_PHYSICS|STATUS_PHANTOM) to boolean Value.\nFor a full list of STATUS_* constants, see wiki documentation.

functions.name: llSetText
functions.doc: Causes Text to float above the prim, using the specified Color and Opacity.

functions.name: llSetTexture
functions.doc: Applies Texture to Face of prim.\nTexture may be a UUID or name of a texture in prim inventory.\nIf Face is ALL_SIDES, set the texture on all faces.

functions.name: llSetTextureAnim

params.name: mode
params.doc: Mask of Mode flags.

params.name: face
params.doc: Face number or ALL_SIDES.

params.name: sizex
params.doc: Horizontal frames (ignored for ROTATE and SCALE).

params.name: sizey
params.doc: Vertical frames (ignored for ROTATE and SCALE).

params.name: start
params.doc: Start position/frame number (or radians for ROTATE).

params.name: length
params.doc: number of frames to display (or radians for ROTATE).

params.name: rate
params.doc: Frames per second (must not greater than zero).

functions.doc:
Animates a texture by setting the texture scale and offset.
Mode is a bitmask of animation options.
Face specifies which object face to animate.
SizeX and SizeY specify the number of horizontal and vertical frames.Start specifes the animation start point.
Length specifies the animation duration.
Rate specifies the animation playback rate.

functions.name: llSetTimerEvent
functions.doc: Causes the timer event to be triggered every Rate seconds.\n Passing in 0.0 stops further timer events.

functions.name: llSetTorque

params.name: torque
params.doc: Torque force.

params.name: local
params.doc: Boolean, if TRUE uses local axis, if FALSE uses region axis.

functions.doc: Sets the Torque acting on the script's object, in object-local coordinates if Local == TRUE (otherwise, the region reference frame is used).\nOnly works on physical objects.

functions.name: llSetTouchText
functions.doc: Displays Text in the viewer context menu that acts on a touch.

functions.name: llSetVehicleFlags
functions.doc: Enables the vehicle flags specified in the Flags bitmask.\nValid parameters can be found in the wiki documentation.

functions.name: llSetVehicleFloatParam
functions.doc: Sets a vehicle float parameter.\nValid parameters can be found in the wiki documentation.

functions.name: llSetVehicleRotationParam
functions.doc: Sets a vehicle rotation parameter.\nValid parameters can be found in the wiki documentation.

functions.name: llSetVehicleType
functions.doc: Activates the vehicle action on the object with vehicle preset Type.\nValid Types and an explanation of their characteristics can be found in wiki documentation.

functions.name: llSetVehicleVectorParam
functions.doc: Sets a vehicle vector parameter.\nValid parameters can be found in the wiki documentation.

functions.name: llSetVelocity

params.name: velocity
params.doc: The velocity to apply.

params.name: local
params.doc: If TRUE, the Velocity is treated as a local directional vector instead of a regional directional vector.

functions.doc: If the object is physics-enabled, sets the object's linear velocity to Velocity.\nIf Local==TRUE, Velocity is treated as a local directional vector; otherwise, Velocity is treated as a global directional vector.

functions.name: llSHA1String
functions.doc: Returns a string of 40 hex characters that is the SHA1 security Hash of Text.

functions.name: llShout
functions.doc: Shouts Text on Channel.\nThis chat method has a range of 100m radius.\nPUBLIC_CHANNEL is the public chat channel that all avatars see as chat text. DEBUG_CHANNEL is the script debug channel, and is also visible to nearby avatars. All other channels are are not sent to avatars, but may be used to communicate with scripts.

functions.name: llSin
functions.doc: Returns the sine of Theta (Theta in radians).

functions.name: llSitTarget
functions.doc: Set the sit location for this object. If offset == ZERO_VECTOR, clears the sit target.

functions.name: llSleep
functions.doc: Put script to sleep for Time seconds.

functions.name: llSound
functions.doc: Deprecated: Use llPlaySound instead.\nPlays Sound at Volume and specifies whether the sound should loop and/or be enqueued.

functions.name: llSoundPreload
functions.doc: Deprecated: Use llPreloadSound instead.\nPreloads a sound on viewers within range.

functions.name: llSqrt
functions.doc: Returns the square root of Value.\nTriggers a math runtime error for imaginary results (if Value < 0.0).

functions.name: llStartAnimation
functions.doc: This function plays the specified animation from playing on the avatar who received the script's most recent permissions request.\nAnimation may be an animation in task inventory or a built-in animation.\nRequires PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION.

functions.name: llStopAnimation
functions.doc: This function stops the specified animation on the avatar who received the script's most recent permissions request.\nAnimation may be an animation in task inventory, a built-in animation, or the uuid of an animation.\nRequires PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION.

functions.name: llStopHover
functions.doc: Stop hovering to a height (due to llSetHoverHeight()).

functions.name: llStopLookAt
functions.doc: Stop causing object to point at a target (due to llLookAt() or llRotLookAt()).

functions.name: llStopMoveToTarget
functions.doc: Stops critically damped motion (due to llMoveToTarget()).

functions.name: llStopSound
functions.doc: Stops playback of the currently attached sound.

functions.name: llStringLength
functions.doc: Returns an integer that is the number of characters in Text (not counting the null).

functions.name: llStringToBase64
functions.doc: Returns the string Base64 representation of the input string.

functions.name: llStringTrim

params.name: src
params.doc: String to trim

params.name: type
params.doc: STRING_TRIM_HEAD, STRING_TRIM_TAIL, or STRING_TRIM.

functions.doc:
Outputs a string, eliminating white-space from the start and/or end of the input string Text.
Valid options for TrimType:
STRING_TRIM_HEAD: trim all leading spaces in Text
STRING_TRIM_TAIL: trim all trailing spaces in Text
STRING_TRIM: trim all leading and trailing spaces in Text.

functions.name: llSubStringIndex
functions.doc: Returns an integer that is the index in Text where string pattern Sequence first appears. Returns -1 if not found.

functions.name: llTakeCamera
functions.doc: Deprecated: Use llSetCameraParams instead.

functions.name: llTakeControls

params.name: controls
params.doc: Bit-field of CONTROL_* flags.

params.name: accept
params.doc: Boolean, determines whether control events are generated.

params.name: pass_on
params.doc: Boolean, determines whether controls are disabled.

functions.doc: Take controls from the agent the script has permissions for.\nIf (Accept == (Controls & input)), send input to the script.  PassOn determines whether Controls also perform their normal functions.\nRequires the PERMISSION_TAKE_CONTROLS permission to run.

functions.name: llTan
functions.doc: Returns the tangent of Theta (Theta in radians).

functions.name: llTarget
functions.doc: This function is to have the script know when it has reached a position.\nIt registers a Position with a Range that triggers at_target and not_at_target events continuously until unregistered.

functions.name: llTargetOmega
functions.doc: Attempt to spin at SpinRate with strength Gain on Axis.\nA spin rate of 0.0 cancels the spin. This function always works in object-local coordinates.

functions.name: llTargetRemove
functions.doc: Removes positional target Handle registered with llTarget.

functions.name: llTeleportAgent

params.name: agent
params.doc: UUID of avatar.

params.name: landmark
params.doc: Name of landmark (in object contents), or empty string, to use.

params.name: position
params.doc: If no landmark was provided, the position within the current region to teleport the avatar to.

params.name: look_at
params.doc: The position within the target region that the avatar should be turned to face upon arrival.

functions.doc: Requests a teleport of avatar to a landmark stored in the object's inventory. If no landmark is provided (an empty string), the avatar is teleported to the location position in the current region. In either case, the avatar is turned to face the position given by look_at in local coordinates.\nRequires the PERMISSION_TELEPORT permission. This function can only teleport the owner of the object.

functions.name: llTeleportAgentGlobalCoords

params.name: agent
params.doc: UUID of avatar.

params.name: global_coordinates
params.doc: Global coordinates of the destination region. Can be retrieved by using llRequestSimulatorData(region_name, DATA_SIM_POS).

params.name: region_coordinates
params.doc: The position within the target region to teleport the avatar to, if no landmark was provided.

params.name: look_at
params.doc: The position within the target region that the avatar should be turned to face upon arrival.

functions.doc: Teleports an agent to the RegionPosition local coordinates within a region which is specified by the GlobalPosition global coordinates. The agent lands facing the position defined by LookAtPoint local coordinates.\nRequires the PERMISSION_TELEPORT permission. This function can only teleport the owner of the object.

functions.name: llTeleportAgentHome
functions.doc: Teleport agent over the owner's land to agent's home location.

functions.name: llTextBox
functions.doc: Opens a dialog for the specified avatar with message Text, which contains a text box for input. Any text that is entered is said on the specified Channel (as if by the avatar) when the "OK" button is clicked.

functions.name: llToLower
functions.doc: Returns a string that is Text with all lower-case characters.

functions.name: llToUpper
functions.doc: Returns a string that is Text with all upper-case characters.

functions.name: llTransferLindenDollars
functions.doc: Transfer Amount of linden dollars (L$) from script owner to AvatarID. Returns a key to a corresponding transaction_result event for the success of the transfer.\nAttempts to send the amount of money to the specified avatar, and trigger a transaction_result event identified by the returned key.

functions.name: llTriggerSound
functions.doc: Plays Sound at Volume (0.0 - 1.0), centered at but not attached to object.\nThere is no limit to the number of triggered sounds which can be generated by an object, and calling llTriggerSound does not affect the attached sounds created by llPlaySound and llLoopSound. This is very useful for things like collision noises, explosions, etc. There is no way to stop or alter the volume of a sound triggered by this function.

functions.name: llTriggerSoundLimited
functions.doc: Plays Sound at Volume (0.0 - 1.0), centered at but not attached to object, limited to axis-aligned bounding box defined by vectors top-north-east (TNE) and bottom-south-west (BSW).\nThere is no limit to the number of triggered sounds which can be generated by an object, and calling llTriggerSound does not affect the attached sounds created by llPlaySound and llLoopSound. This is very useful for things like collision noises, explosions, etc. There is no way to stop or alter the volume of a sound triggered by this function.

functions.name: llUnescapeURL
functions.doc: Returns the string that is the URL unescaped, replacing "%20" with spaces, etc., version of URL.\nThis function can output raw UTF-8 strings.

functions.name: llUnSit
functions.doc: If agent identified by AvatarID is sitting on the object the script is attached to or is over land owned by the objects owner, the agent is forced to stand up.

functions.name: llUpdateCharacter

params.name: options
params.doc: Character configuration options. Takes the same constants as llCreateCharacter().

functions.doc: Updates settings for a pathfinding character.

functions.name: llUpdateKeyValue
functions.doc: Starts an asychronous transaction to update the value associated with the key given. The dataserver callback will be executed with the key returned from this call and a string describing the result. The result is a two element commma-delimited list. The first item is an integer specifying if the transaction succeeded (1) or not (0). In the failure case, the second item will be an integer corresponding to one of the XP_ERROR_... constants. In the success case the second item will be the value associated with the key. If Checked is 1 the existing value in the data store must match the OriginalValue passed or XP_ERROR_RETRY_UPDATE will be returned. If Checked is 0 the key will be created if necessary.

functions.name: llVecDist
functions.doc: Returns the distance between Location1 and Location2.

functions.name: llVecMag
functions.doc: Returns the magnitude of the vector.

functions.name: llVecNorm
functions.doc: Returns normalized vector.

functions.name: llVolumeDetect

params.name: detect
params.doc: TRUE enables, FALSE disables.

functions.doc: If DetectEnabled = TRUE, object becomes phantom but triggers collision_start and collision_end events when other objects start and stop interpenetrating.\nIf another object (including avatars) interpenetrates it, it will get a collision_start event.\nWhen an object stops interpenetrating, a collision_end event is generated. While the other is inter-penetrating, collision events are NOT generated.

functions.name: llWanderWithin

params.name: origin
params.doc: Central point to wander about.

params.name: dist
params.doc: Half-extents of an area the character may wander within. (i.e., it can wander from the specified origin by up to +/-Distance.x in x, +/-Distance.y in y, etc.)

params.name: options
params.doc: No options available at this time.

functions.doc: Wander within a specified volume.\nSets a character to wander about a central spot within a specified area.

functions.name: llWater
functions.doc: Returns the water height below the object position + Offset.

functions.name: llWhisper
functions.doc: Whispers Text on Channel.\nThis chat method has a range of 10m radius.\nPUBLIC_CHANNEL is the public chat channel that all avatars see as chat text. DEBUG_CHANNEL is the script debug channel, and is also visible to nearby avatars. All other channels are are not sent to avatars, but may be used to communicate with scripts.

functions.name: llWind
functions.doc: Returns the wind velocity at the object position + Offset.

functions.name: llXorBase64
functions.doc: Performs an exclusive OR on two Base64 strings and returns a Base64 string. Text2 repeats if it is shorter than Text1.

functions.name: llXorBase64Strings
functions.doc: Deprecated: Please use llXorBase64 instead.\nIncorrectly performs an exclusive OR on two Base64 strings and returns a Base64 string. Text2 repeats if it is shorter than Text1.\nRetained for backwards compatibility.

functions.name: llXorBase64StringsCorrect
functions.doc: Deprecated: Please use llXorBase64 instead.\nCorrectly (unless nulls are present) performs an exclusive OR on two Base64 strings and returns a Base64 string.\nText2 repeats if it is shorter than Text1.
